text:
I love the movie theatre and fat burger but in the buffet, they need some work.
Use homemade ranch or don't serve it at all. Bottled ranch in a restaurant is not cool. Also bring back the oyster sauce at the Mongolian bbq section. That's the best one. Other than that the place is pretty clean and food is good.

Paid $136/night for dark, dingy room, old carpet throughout, thread bare linens, a view of a cement wall, no air exchange in the bathrooms ICK. A/C unit worked, thank goodness. Air exchange on casino floor is either sub par or overwhelmed be the number smokers. Food Court was good for our group of teenagers. Property looks like it needs updating in general. Not one complaint about the staff but there are definitely deferred maintenance issues at this property.

My family were in Las Vegas and we stayed in Fiesta Henderson last May 31.this is our second stay in this hotel. we like to stay here because it always offers the lowest rate for our family like us who is always on budget and have simple needs. the first stay three years ago was ok. but the second stay was a rather gross disappointment because of the housekeeping. the toilet bowl wasn't scrubbed.Now, i know toilet when it is not done, this is my favorite spot to clean. when we came from strolling the strip of las vegas.so now that i saw that, it made me question of the rest of the sanitation in the other areas like towels and bed sheets. it wasn't like this the first time. i hope they pay more attention to this. such a waste if they woulsdl ose clients this way. the front desk though was excellent. no pretense. just downright warmth and calm.

I stayed here but was disappointed as its Air Conditioner does not work properly. Once you sleep the AC also sleeps.

Once you set a room temperature and that temperature is reached the AC shuts down and never starts even if the temperature is more than what's in the thermostat. You need to constantly moving so that the AC is On. The hair dryer was not functioning and find hair inside it.
You need to wait 10 minutes or so to get connected to the front desk.

Went here with some fiends we were desperate looking for a place to stay and decided to go here.  Wasn't bad but the security ket harrassing me the whole time which was a really big turn off.  Never been harrassed by a security guard in my entire life and I have been to every hotel in Vegas.  This white dork with glasses was just really bored and had drank way to much coffee or taken too much speed and would not leave us alone.  I fianlly had to complain to the front desk.  The guy even asked me what room i was staying in.  First he goes you can't walk around with your shirt un buttoned then we went to the pool at like 8pm and hes like the pools closed get out now and was totall dick about it, then he tried to follow us to our rooms, CREEEEPO!!!! dont go ehre the security is on tweek or something complete freaks sorry fiesta but you suuuuck!

i am only reviewing the buffet. Mostly because i do not frequent buffets, and in the past when i have i was fairly disgusted. HOWEVER, this was amaaaazing enough to go back to a couple days later. for 6.99 dinner buffet i couldnt stay there long enough. Everything was amazing, including the made to order mongolian section.

Terrible place to book a stay!! My fianc√© and I got a room for the weekend. We both woke up with rashes from the linen and the room was extremely stuffy!! Never again will We be staying there. Try Eastside Cannery or Boulder Station nicer and cleaner rooms.

Stay the hell away from the buffet, unless you enjoy eating with other people animals, I sat  down to eat my lunch and low and behold people eating at the buffet is taking there animals up to the buffet as the animals are stiffing all over the food. I ask for the Manager who seem to be not surprise by this as she told me it not just for service animals but your companion( dogs, snakes, rabbits, cats, birds) as well. They are a pet friendly hotel and you are also allowed to have your animal gamble right next to you well playing slot machines. I gamble in this casino at least three times a week and this is my first time ever seeing animals in the casino next to their owners unleashed. This casino have lost my
Business (10k) a year. I rather play in a casino and eat in a casino where I don't have to have worry about tics and fleas jumping all over the place.

If you're looking for a non-glitzy casino to hang out at, this is just the place. I've spent countless hours at this establishment to kill time. I had pretty good luck on the Wheel of Fortune machines. I went here for the Bingo games. It's smaller than some other casinos, so it can get stuffy. Free donuts if you go to the earlier games. :) I stayed at the hotel once, and I wouldn't ever go back. I probably paid less than $50 for the room, and it became pretty obvious why it was so cheap. I have a pretty sensitive nose, and one night was enough to deter me from staying there the second night. Nonetheless, it's a fun, quiet casino to gamble your money away. Shoot, you can even show up in your pajamas and no one would bat an eyelash.

If you are going here for anything other than the movie theater or Fatburger, don't expect much. Nkw in the other hand if you are from out of town and on a budget, this could be your hotel. 

This is and always will be labeled a locals casino. However, a coworker of mine recently stayed here with no rental car and it worked out great. It was cheap and he didn't need to leave to go find something to eat. Everything he needed was right there....except something that I feel is a big deal. There is no laundry room available. Not even a service they offer. So if you are staying here exclusively, please keep that in mind.

The worse stay ever. I don't even write reviews but this called for one. First, they only activated one of my keys so without knowing I used the activated key first then the next morning when I used the other key I was locked out. Called downstairs, man put me on hold for so long I leave my bags in front my room and go down there to discover him doing nothing and no one in line. Thats the first incident. I also had a constant leak in the shower so the tub kept filling up. Second, my friend went back to the hotel for my retainer that was left. They then told him that it was thrown away. Terrible.  Last, they refunded $77 dollars as my deposit. Then 3 days later took the money back to reprocess the refund and without me knowing I had to call my bank and they said my refund would be coming back within a few MORE days and told me to call the hotel and see why the put my refund back and then took it back. In short, again. It was bad. I wouldn't do it again if I was paid to. Green Valley Ranch will now be taking my money.

I came to stay at the Fiesta Henderson on short notice. I picked it because I has stayed at Boulder Station and it was nice. Fiesta Henderson (a Station Hotel) was not so nice. The nicest part of the hotel is the rooms. They looked nice and were pretty comfortable, if you don't mind dust that it. There was dust on the lampshade, mirrors, tv, etc. I thank Hotel Impossible for teaching me what to look for. Next, we had to eat....Man, you wanna try a Vegas area buffet that sucks. Try this one. It was like middle school cafeteria food. Next, we went to the Fiesta Cafe (used to be Dennys), and that food was also bad. The breakfast food was pretty good. Dinner was not, service was also slow, and they hound you to get a players card every time...Clearly maintenence issues all around that as a customer I could see. Positives: wifi was not working and i called down to the front desk and got great assistance right away.  Pool was nice. Overall, if I had to I would stay there again. Its not baaaad (except for the food), but it wasn't up to par.

We didn't enjoy our stay at the Fiesta very much.  Expedia had a special of some sort for them -- and then delisted them immediately, so I can't even post a review on the site that sold us the "discounted room".  We had been hoping for an airport hotel; in fact the Fiesta is a solid 30 minutes on the highway from the LV airport.  It has a dingy, seedy feeling -- the gaming rooms seem popular and crowded, but there are no reasonable restaurants (e.g. you can get a burger or pizza but nothing "fancy"), and the room was damp, smelled of tobacco despite being a non-smoking room, and had lumpy, soft mattresses that made you sort of shudder thinking of hygiene.  The swimming pool looked nice but my wife and sister in law said that it reeked of chlorine to a point that they didn't want to stay in it for long.

So all in all, I recommend giving this one a pass.  It badly needs a significant renovation.

PS: I'm not a gamer so ignore this review if you are coming to play the slots or something.  If anything, that side of the place looked very popular.

Wish I could give it 0 stars too!!! Warning if you eat at buffet....bakery guy in plain site has a weird obsession with licking his fingers and touching every plate he serves!!! He is the only one we seen without gloves on. We couldn't believe our eyes.  Watching him in disbelief he licked his fingers time and time again and poked deserts! Absolutely disgusting!!! 

And the room to top it all of after a nice hot shower was to pull down the sheets and find bed bugs. Immediately called front desk and she said that it's probably just fruit flies! Are you kidding me? I don't think so!!! They put us in an off room suite with a cardboard feeling bed for our "inconvenience of bed bugs". Will never stay here again!!!

Good as a hotel; casino filled with old, sad people.

The Fiesta is a fairly tired casino that appears to attract an ageing and/or lower income clientele. Nothing wrong with that at all, but it's something of which to be aware. I chose to stay a week in their hotel because the rates are very good: this week I paid  average $38 per night, plus a $10 per day resort fee for a total of $48 per night. The fee includes WiFi, and I'm sure some other amenities but I don't plan to go and find them because they're sure to be just ok. There is no workout facility.

It seems that room rates fluctuate wildly and daily, so it's important to check daily for the best deal. For example, 3 weeks out from now the rates average $69/day but 2 weeks out average $29/day (both excluding resort fee).

My room is plenty adequate: the bed is comfy and the room large but sparse. Better than average quality hotel furniture but dated (but not badly so). The bathroom is workable; it appears to share the same ventilation system as the casino because I can smell the cigarette smoke lightly drifting in. It's not terrible but if you're sensitive to smoke then be aware of it.

I will come back for another work trip soon because it's cheap and comfortable. The casino itself is sorry and smokey so I'm definitely not going to indulge there.

My first yelp review! Worst  checking in my 30 years of travel. One front desk person and she spent 45 minutes with one person that was checking in a 30 person group! Tried to get her to call for help or just checkin 10 from group then take a person from the line ( only 2 people in line) - but she waited until the full group was taking care of before handling anyone else .  And this group was making deposit in CASH!

No common sense here.

Only good news is after 30 minute wait had plenty of time to write this review.

I will post after I get my room.

Of course reserved king got 2 queen with a/c that could only cool to about 76.

Never again.

When my boyfriend and I started dating on Christmas of 2012...one of the places he wanted to take my kids and I was too the festival buffet. I remember the first time we went....it was pretty good. I ate till I nearly popped and the kids enjoyed it. we go back a lot but every time it gets worse and worse and my stomach just cant handle it.

They seem to be changing a lot of the menu items and it gets skimpier and skimpier. The staff is okay....some of them will check up on you a lot and some just pass you by as if your just another number floating in the breeze. My boyfriend actually complained to the manager about it once because our waiter was refilling everyone's drink but ours.  I have no clue why we go back, I guess its more for the kids sake because we no longer enjoy it much. The foods quality and preparation has gone from maybe around  an 8 to about a 3. I don't recommend going unless you have a 2 for 1 and your desperate for food.

If it were not for it being a quick cheap dinner for the kids I would never go back. Just in a year the food and service has gone down hill.

HORRIBLE!!!HORRIBLE!!!HORRIBLE!!! Customer Service....This casino is very unprofessional, I was playing the roulette wheel and won ($560.00) so I asked the dealer "Gasper" when he gave me my chips "how much did I win"? No answer. I proceeded to ask again but this time infront of His supervisor" Hector" Who also says to me " You don't  know how to count" Excuse me I replied, he continues by telling me "honey this isn't Rancho, this is Henderson." I don't know what the supervisor meant by that comment but yes I was stun to hear that and especially from a supervisor. To my friends and family all I can say don't give this casino your business...to everyone else I say the same.
Don't stay here! The rooms are dirty and smelly. I found a shoe, plastic Baggie, white powdery stuff, a squished bug behind the headboard, and if that isn't enough....a condom wrapper on the floor.

Sunday brunch was terrible. The bacon was the limpest and greasiest I've ever had. By contrast the sausage links were crusty-overlooked. The scrambled eggs were rubbery dry. 
Coupled with the length of wait time for the cashier to leisurely process customers things did not improve once seated. Our wait person could not be found for initial drink requests. We finally gave up and went for the food only to return to our table and wait 5 more minutes for service. 

The crowning disparaging point is Fiesta has removed all fresh fruit from their menu. This is unbelievable for such a venue. 

I suggest passing on their brunch until they feel customer service pinch enough to improve poor quality and service.

*** LOOK OUT FOR RIPOFF PRICING ***

I booked this hotel on Expedia for about $22 a night, mid week rates.  When I got here the hotel wants to charge an extra (approx) $12 a day for "resort fee for wifi, etc" and it was mandatory.  There's no way around it.  So basically the $22 price is a lie when it's really about $35 a night.

See other reviews.  Many others complain about the same resort fee.

I would be fine with this basic, old casino hotel paying $35 a night without the trickery - it's clean enough, and it's old, and the casino is smoky - it's much nicer than a crappy Motel 6 in any little town by the interstates.  But I'm putting down only 1 star for the pricing issue above.

Buyer be aware!

I never actually stayed here (room).  The review is of their buffet.  I simply loved it.  It was cheap, the food was good and there was plenty of it.  Feeling a little mexican food they got it, American yup, Asian, yup seafood, salad, desert all covered.  The best for me was making my tacos and then doing the mashed potato with chicken thing.  Then when I know my family is still going to sit around and talk, I hit the Crawfish.  This place got me hooked on Crawfish.  I had bout two or three plates full of these cajun wonders.  Good food, good price.  four stars

Worst hotel experience ever.  Day 1,I checked in and asked the girl at the front desk where would be a good place to go dancing.  She said, "I don't know.  We don't have that here." When I got to my room I called down to the front desk, " can I have a lightbulb it's dark in here and the lights don't work?  Oh no, I'm late!  No, the time on the clock is 45 minutes fast I guess I'll set it myself.. at least the numbers on the clock were dimmly lighting the room.  Day 2,  can I please have batteries for the remote?  Day 3, I used the 2 oz of shampoo you provided on day 1 and 2,  Is it too much to ask to get another 2 oz  since I'm staying 5 days?   Oh, and the 2 plastic drinking cups have been used and thrown away.  Can I have a cup so I don't have to suck water from the sink?  Day 4, no hot water which means no shower and no food because the restaurants can't open without hot water.  I skipped day 5 and stayed with a friend.  Maybe they should advertise as a camping casino.  Bring your own everything.

Bleh!!!!!!  The casino is fine.  The ROOM was a complete disappointment.  To start, the up/down button on the wall to get the elevator was punched in (the whole wall plate).  Our room stunk like dirty feet.  The room was SPARSELY decorated. Cheap, cheap, CHEAP!  While in the shower, the tub didn't drain and the surrounding wall was peeling and gross!  While brushing my teeth, the sink didn't drain.  Definitely WOULD NOT recommend this place.

I booked my room soley on the basis of location.  I was a little nervous after checking out the reviews here, but was pleasantly pleased with how my trip turned out.  Every employee I came in contact with was friendly and helpful.  The room was very basic, but was clean and quiet.  I only ate breakfast here, and the food is nothing fancy, but for $4 you can find something that satisfies.  I just needed a place to sleep that was clean and quiet and the Fiesta met my needs.

It's just all around bad.  We've stayed here a few times but it is just progressively getting worse and worse.  The air doesn't work, it's beyond dirty and trying to take a shower is a joke. I will NEVER stay here again.

Have stayed here a few times!  The rooms are good and were clean!  Yes its not done out like a strip hotel/casino but if that's what you want go stay on the strip.  I have had no problems here and enjoyed my stay and have eaten at several of the restaurants and again no problems with the food or the service from the staff!

Easy access from the freeway and not far from the water street district!

I would stay again no problem!  And I don't gamble so what the casino is like downstairs does not really affect my stay!

I checked in here because I got a good room rate. Save yourself the trouble, they advertise free wifi. You actually get basic wifi that is very poor and have to pay $7.99 more a day for wifi that will allow you a half decent connection. Then when you get to your room if you choose the basic (which is pretty much useless) you are stuck with it for 24 hrs before you can pay to upgrade it. Help from front desk was confusing and resulted in not be able to upgrade the wifi.

So I watched a movie then decided to play $60 at some slots & keno. Well didn't work out at all. I've lost before no big deal, but I've never felt cheated like I do after I tried playing here. I've done better on the strip. It's too bad I kinda liked this place.

Ahh. The Fiesta Henderson poker room. It's the closest poker room from the crib. If you like playing no limit poker, then this card room is defiantly not for you. If you like playing against locals that talk all that jazz about how good their odds are for making the call(keep in mind that that they only play 2-4 limit), then come on down! And if you want to blend in with the locals, be sure to wear your shades, your poker hat that you bought with all of your Stations player points and your 3rd generation iPod that has only 7 songs on it. Don't get me started on the players that stiff the dealer. Meet me there, I'll be the guy wearing the "I got the nuts!" t-shirt.
The late night menu at cafe fiesta is decent and priced well. Pancakes though are some of the best I have had! My 5 year old loves the buffet.

So I dragged my partner to bingo at the Fiesta Henderson last night and pay back was going for Mexican food. I did not want to go to amigos as the previous times we had been there the service and food were really poor. I was pleasantly surprised, the menu has changed and has many great additions and the service has improved greatly. I am pleased to say this is back on the list of my local hangouts. The Carnitas were delicious.

We stayed here last minute after a bad experience off the LV Strip left us stranded and needing a place to stay. I had stayed here before, but had forgotten until we pulled in. Clean room and friendly staff. The heater worked a little too well and the bed could have been a little softer. But it was great for the money! I'd definitely stay here again!

They get one star because the AC in the room works and the valet was nice.

The hotel is outdated. Beds are terribly uncomfortable and mattresses are well past their prime.  Carpet is torn and stained.

The worst part is the front desk staff. First, you chose customer service, so if you hate people,  you should rethink that.  My reservation for a king bed meant nothing. Then they charge a deposit on top of having paid for the room in advance. And, they charge a daily resort fee.  Between the rude staff and the nickel and dime charges, I won't be back, and I won't spend a penny in their casino. I'd rather drive to the Strip to play then give these schlubs any more money.

Very. Very. Very. Disappointed.

Stay away from hotel, yikes! boy did I get what i payed for got even less, first Dirty, Dusty, old. could not breath clearly, air conditioner coils and vent had not been cleaned for years, i could swipe my finger on any piece of furniture and yikes,,,dust everywhere, carpet is stained, and to boot we did not travel with pets and they stuck us in a pet staying room, our next door guests had pets and we could hear them barking, and we could see where a dog( s)were scratched up  the door, would have left but no cancelling possible and this was our first time to Las Vegas, we decided to   stay and visited the strip and hoover dam, that was the fun part!  I left a nice note for maid to clean but NO go came back from the strip still dirty, the just made the bed and left clean towels and left, while on line searching the pictures were photo shopped to look nicer!  and as checking out gal at registration desk just printed our receipt and did not even ask how our stay was, mmm wonder why? STAY AT YOUR OWN RISK! 
NEVER AGAIN FOR ME!

Once I was brought to my table, I sat for a couple minutes to order my drink before I started the smorgasbord. Nothing. So, I went to fill up my plate. I returned to the table with a hot plate, and wait again for a server. Meanwhile, food is cooling down. To avoid neglecting myself from a hot meal, I began to eat. But wait, I need tabasco. Apparently, the lady seated behind me needed service also, but she decided to walk up to a service station and get her own tabasco sauce. It wasn't until I went to do the same when the server finally came to ask if I wanted a drink. The elderly couple tried to flag down that server 2 times before they were able to get service as well. So, minus 2 stars for bad service.
Cheese tortellini was awful. The orange chicken was mostly just orange tempura batter. The only things that had any flavor was the breakfast sausage links, corned beef hash, and the sugar cone that holstered my yogurt, all of which takes minimal attention from anyone. Minus one more star. The fact that they didn't burn the precooked hash, or undercook the links, or put out crushed cones was why they gotten any stars at all.
Pay attention people- if you were running an airport, nevermind. Bad example. That's it. Bad example for a buffet.
Absolutely loved the service at this buffet and the food and staff were amazing!! I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a great place to eat and have some fun gambling!!!
I was passing thru and saw a special on hotels.com. Hotel is very dingy! I felt so disgusted that I slept in my clothes and made an early exit. Never again!!

On my 80th birthday I went to the Fiesta Buffett for a Corned Beef dinner. NO boiled potatoes, NO Carrots, there was Cabbage, but it wasn't cooked and only barely warm. The Corned Beef was inedible full of gristle and fat. I never did eat an actual piece of meat.

I can't understand why anyone would not give the Fiesta a 5 star rating.  This was one of the nicest (not fancy) hotel/casinos we have stayed at.  The room was spotless and the mattress was the most comfortable I have slept on in any hotel.  The front desk employees were very polite and accommadating.  The casino is nicely laid out too.  The food was excellent in the buffet.  I definitely want to go back.  Thank you Fiesta!

We stayed here just to sleep while passing through on our vacation. The room was an unbeatable price ($29) and the room was extremely clean and comfy. Our tv and wifi worked great and we ordered pizza to our room with ease. Seriously cannot beat the price, especially for how good of condition our room was. If we are ever passing by again we will stay here!

The hotel staff seemed rushed and didn't explain anything that they were just swiping my card for. When I got to my room it smelled awful and the sheets and pillow case had blood on them. Yes blood!! When I called the front desk the only thing they said was that they'd call housekeeping. They sent a woman who was very nice who replaced the sheets and pillow cases. The walls were so thin all I could hear was my extremely sick neighbor coughing and sneezing alllll night. Terrible hotel. Will not be staying here again

I am in the Las Vegas area twice a month for family and other pleasures. I usually stay at the Aliante when in North Las Vegas, or a Marriott property when elsewhere. This time, I gambled and tried this Station casino property. Mistake.
It has seen better times and, unfortunately, management sees no real need to advance it into 2015. The rooms were staid, the beds barren (no spreads, extra pillows, or comforters). 
It's worth noting that the upscale Aliante was once a Station property. The Aliante has done much better since leaving that fold. Kudos to them.
I noticed people walking non-service dogs into the Fiesta's casino; I didn't inquire as to whether the hotel is pet friendly, but that's a no-no for me. There are some spaces I don't care to share. 
The front desk staff was trained, but mechanical. I paid my security deposit in cash, so as not to have my credit card encumbered for up to ten business days. When I got home, I found that they charged the deposit to my credit card anyway. That means they held two security deposits simultaneously. Egads.
I won't return. Better to pay a few dollars more elsewhere and get the better experience. 
The good: The price. The Regal Theatre. 
The bad: Everything else.

After a long day driving in the wrong direction and a longer day driving to our final destination, I can say I was not planning on much from the $20.86 room awaiting me at the Fiesta Henderson Hotel & Casino, however I was mistaken. This is by no means a luxury hotel, but for the price, it was fantastic. This was a room well worth $60-70, with plenty of amenities and the staff was really nice. There was a $10 "resort fee" when we got there, but racked it up to what we would pay for wifi anywhere else. All in all, we spent about $30 and were thrilled, and stayed several hours later than we expected. If you are expecting a clean hotel, friendly staff, and no bells or whistles, the Fiesta is for you.

Royal flush ur money down the toilet capital of the world!! Worst place to gamble! If I thought it would do any good I'd call the gaming control commission on there machines, but I know how the industry works and I know that's a waste of time! Being in the industry I can guarantee u that this place is not on the up and up! Gambler beware of this dump

I have gambled there few times , but mostly we go there for the buffet , two for one with the coupon they send out. This is very cheap buffet but food is not that bad at all. Clean and attentive staff.

Fiesta is a Mexican latin themed hotel .property & they discontinued their Mexican restaurant.  WHAT!!!  I repeat WHAT!!!  Makes no sense. Very Dumb management decision.  And at the buffet, the food station for Mexico they have a huge sign labeling the food as Mexicano.  Probably because it rhymes with "Chicano" that shows how the Fiesta and Station Casino management are all out of touch.  When the property was "The Reserve" it had a bit more class and seemed more in touch with their resort theme,  Now not so with this Fiesta Stations casino property.

We made a reservation through American Express with a confirmation for a king bedded room.  When we arrived we were advised they had none left but we were"upgraded" to a room with a Murphy bed pullout. When we arrived it was clear that we received the living room section of a suite with a very small Murphy bed big enough for one. They refused to walk us to another hotel which is the standard practice when a hotel is sold out and the room type which was confirmed is unavailable. The room was dusty and filthy. The Murphy bed was broken as several of the wood slats that hold up the "mattress" were broken and missing. I tried to make another reservation elsewhere but it was a citywide sellout due to a nascar race. The next morning at 9a I asked for the manager on duty and as advised there was none available. I left my business card with the front desk and asked for a call from the GM but a week later have not received one. This place is a dump and their cleanliness is non existent as you can see from my pictures.    


Update 
I disputed the charges with Amex as I booked through their website. I won, they lost. I ended up paying zero for this day which is still too much given the disgusting room. Shame on you fiesta for not acting in a professional manner upon not providing the guaranteed room type for your customers, we should have been walked to another hotel!

The overall stay at the Fiesta was not that bad besides the fact that my bed sheets and blanket completely smelt like mildew that it was lingering on my clothes even after I got up from the bed. we had to call housekeeping to ask for new ones because they smelt THAT bad. Completely disgusting. that and also the line to check out was ridiculous. it was 20 mins before check out time and there was only one person at the desk working with a huge line. I won't be staying here again just based on those things. there is no excuse for either of those.
The staff was great the food was excellent. The rooms were good but our door didnt close unless we slammed it otherwise it was great!
angry dealers, nasty tables, not worth the gas even when you live around the corner

I suppose for $54.99 per night you can't ask for too much, but my wife and I were not too excited about our room or experience.  We needed to find a room in Henderson and did not go to the Fiesta for the casino, in fact we didn't even go to the casino except to pass through it.

Our room was not clean and smelled very bad.  It was a non-smoking room, and it didn't smell like cigarette smoke, it just smelled unclean.  Our bathroom was not that clean and the toilet seat was broken and the toilet itself would lean forward when you sat down on it.  

You have to walk through the casino and cigarette smoke to check into your room and to access the elevators, so you have to drag your luggage through the occupied casino and walk in between gambling to get anywhere.  

The pool was OK, however again, to get to the pool you have to walk through part of the casino which seems like a major design flaw.  Who wants to walk past people gambling in your swimsuit to get outside to the pool?  We would not go back.

BEDBUGS, BEDBUGS, BEDBUGS!!  I came over Mother's Day weekend to spend time with my sister as a last minute trip. Arrived at the hotel after 9pm. Went to the room, dropped our stuff off and headed downstairs. Returned to our room just after 2am. Getting ready for bed and picked up the pillow only to find bedbugs crawling on them. I immediately took pictures of them and then called the front desk. They sent up security to take a report. As the guard was waiting for the head security lady was making a copy of my drivers license he saw the bugs too. They took photos and then transferred us to another room. After that, we couldn't sleep, just completely disgusted. The next morning I went to speak with the manager Patrick Amato. Of course, his shift didn't start till noon. At noon, I went back to the front desk, still no manager. At 12:20, I asked them to call him. I was told he was there, but conveniently "in meetings". Finally around 1:30'ish I was able to talk to him. He apologized for the inconvenience, assured me he would contact hotels.com and have my stay refunded. They said they couldn't do anything until after the investigation was completed and they had a positive result of bedbugs. I explained that I had pictures, security had pictures and saw with their own eyes! Outside of transferring me to another room, the customer service from this manager was very poor. I had stayed at this place many times with no issues until this trip. After the bedbugs and being treated so poorly, i highly doubt I will ever return,

The worst!!! Haven't been there in years and will NOT be back anytime soon. Started playing a slot and the right in the middle of a bonus the entire row of machines short out!!! Richard the slot tech was very nice and worked on the machine for what seemed an eternity. All I wanted to do was have a nice time playing a bit and all that I got to do was sit and watch while they tried to get my money out of the machine.

Terrible. Disrespectful staff and security. I use to go there alot because i live close, playing Blackjack there is miserable because the dealers are so disrespectful and rude. No good live music, the buffet is no good and they're rude. Avoid this place

Epic fail for Fiesta Henderson. Website says cafe sells Chinese food til 11pm. We order and 2nd server butts in saying it's only until 10pm. Called over mgr who has the exec chef in tow. As long as they have worked there it's only been til 10..show them their own hotel website and they disagree with me. Up we go and go over to Chinatown.

Bad service ran us right out the door in a few quick minutes.  It was Sunday evening at the (Coco Loco)? bar right inside the front door.  Yes, I am pointing fingers at the late-forty-something barman who was so off-putting that we had to halt our Sunday Funday 'Fiesta' and find another place to game.   
He had the complete power to either a: be nice, have fun, and make some $$ off of the 4 of us or b:  be one of those shitty bartenders who is likely burnt out, hates his life, and is happy to make minimal tips.  We all know which one he chose.
We never got to know whether or not we liked the actual casino.  He soured us to the point that we simply carried on elsewhere.

Buffet was okay for this area. At $10.99 for weekend dinner, I can't really complain. 

However, for a three-year-old to cost $9.99? That's a little much.
A shit load of TVs playing all the games and $1 buds and hot dogs during football... SOLD!!!!

Sucks having to make a one star review. So when I do, I know they deserve it. Being a local, my girlfriend and I go here a lot to drink, eat at the buffet, and gamble. Today, a security guard Brian thought my gf was more than 16 years younger than the legal gambling age, which was a stretch of the imagination. She showed him her  legal and valid international identification card from her country, and then he started with the questions. She answered all his questions, then he asked her to leave the property. She then went to management to discuss first, which no one showed up, so we left. We were loyal local customers who spent money gambling, ate at the buffet, and drank, who are now taking our business somewhere else. In 2 years, every establishment has accepted her valid ID, and we've gambled at Fiesta before with no issues, except for big Brian today. She is almost 40 years old with valid ID, and a loyal customer, who was just driven away at his request. We will not come back, and will take our business elsewhere. When Fiesta gets more complaints on security, you'll see a pattern of terrible customer service. Not worth going here anymore for us. We are given warm welcomes elsewhere.

I come here as much as I do because it's in a great location and offers a little bit of everything.

I remember when the FH was "The Reserve" and had an african safari kind of theme to it.  The only real evidence of the TR are the brass monkey heads that line the bar the mexican restaurant.

Customer service is hit and miss.  From the pit to the bar, sometimes your treated with  the "We love locals" that stations prides it's self on and sometimes your not.

From what I hear the room rates are cheap.  I recently visited some friends that were staying in town.  I take it that the room rates are a direct reflection of the quality of the rooms.  They had a very Motel 6ish kind of vibe to them.

I find it appalling that the Station Casinos LLC policy is to allow customers to make racist comments towards customers and consider it a form of acceptable behavior at their properties.  Their policy is in direct contrast to the Station Casinos LLC Code of Business Conduct and Ethics Policy Statement, paragraph I.(i) which states "maintaining a workplace that is free from discrimination or harassment based on race, gender, age, color, religion or any other characteristic that is unrelated to the Company's interests or otherwise protected by law".

I sent personal letters (April 3, 2017) and emails (March 8, 2017) to the Fertitta brothers and upper management and never received a response from anyone regarding our complaint.

Was gambling for over 2 hours and not one person  had walked up to me. Not security for an I.D. (I'm 21 with braces lol) and I had 3 cocktail waitresses walk by and not stop to ask of I wanted a drink. The place wasn't busy I just don't see any reason to walk around aimlessly ignoring your customers.

Definitely not my finest choice of hotels in Vegas. Only stayed for one night since I was just passing through. Expensive for what it is, since the room was no better than a motel 6 equivalent. The front desk is inconveniently located in the middle of the casino, away from valet , main entrance, or parking lot access. Poor ventalation throughout, and extremely smoky. Service and food at the caf√© was just awful. Will not be returning.
Not the cleanest place for $90 a night ($70 + resort fee & tax). Stained sheets, toothpaste on the hand towel, dirty bathroom countertop and stained shower. 1.5 stars for the convenient location.

The only reason to come to the Fiesta is for the cheap table games. If you like Pai Gow, this is one of, if not THE, only casino in Henderson with $5 Pai Gow.  Don't quote me on that, but I've never seen it anywhere else.

$5 Blackjack as well.

Bonus: dealers here are learning so they screw up a lot and pay you out when you don't deserve it.

One of the worst stays I had in any hotel. 
We made a reservation for a king bed non smoking room. They didn't have our room, they gave our room to someone else. They gave us a different room from what we reserved. And then once we got to our room, it smelt so bad, it was making us sick. They couldn't do anything about it. And I lost in the casino

I have camped on rocks with no pillow and only a sleeping bag and slept better than I did while at the Fiesta. Prisoners at Gitmo may have better mattresses and pillows than those at the Fiesta. Our air conditioning barely functioned (and I think we can all agree that should be a priority in Vegas in July). The wifi was so slow as to be nigh on nonexistent. Our toilet only flushed about half of the time. Everything was dated and slow. For the price, I expected more, even knowing that it wasn't on the strip. Stay at the Motel 6; you'll get better value for your money.

Smokey, inattentive staff with poor restaruants. 
The movie theater, and the starbucks are the only thing that is saving this place for me...

Stayed for two nights at this hotel for a dog show. Chose it because it is "dog friendly". 

We arrived at almost 1am and check in was very easy, staff was friendly. We had two "dog friendly" rooms on the second floor. Was unaware it was also a smoking floor, and none of us smoke. The stench is ripe first thing in the morning around 7, but it smells all day long.

Room was decent, pretty standard for an inexpensive Vegas hotel, however the shower head was awful and there is no fan or ventilation in the restroom. Gross. 

Casino was extremely quiet. At least the hours we were gambling it was. Love the penny slots and the fact that they still have $5 blackjack tables. My only gripe is there seems to be a staff shortage. Yes we gambled at very late hours, but only one cocktail waitress for the whole casino? One front desk employee on check out (asked me to continue waiting in line so she could take two hotel phone calls.

Otherwise a decent hotel for the price.

I did not stay at this hotel.  We stopped here for lunch on the Gray Line Deluxe Hoover Dam tour.  My reviews is just for the decor and buffet.

This place seems very low budget.  Older and not maintained very well.  Walking into the Fiesta, I got the feel that they place has not been updated since the 70's.  It smelled of damp and cigarettes.  

For the price (which was $7 for people just eating there, it was included in my not so Deluxe Gray Line tour), the buffet was fine.  It was fast food and comfort food. . .mac and cheese, pizza, hamburgers, hot dogs---most seemed to be frozen items.  

I am giving this place three stars because despite it's flaws, the staff could not have been nicer.  Everyone was very happy and positive.  They made you feel very welcome.

A disastrous property - and absolutely the worst brand under "Stations".

1.) Food quality is horrendous
2.) Staff in marginally friendly
3.) Cocktail service is abominable
4.) Management is unresponsive
5.) Game mix is poor / pay tables are not consistent with other off-strip properties
6.) Rooms need a major renovation
7.) Front desk is understaffed and overworked
8.) Slot club / food court comping is a confusing mess which takes a great deal of time. All food court comps should be issued by the kiosks on the gaming floor.

This property was lucky to receive a 1-star. But, that is about where it sits.....and will likely remain.

We check into this hotel recently, everything was going well up until returning home to find out we was charge double for one extra night stay. We have our receipt which shows zero balance paid in full for an extra night stay, but upon checking bank account we was charge double for an extra night stay, we called the billing department only to get the run around and excuses of manufactured lies as to why we was charge double. It never ceases to amaze me how greedy corporation and government entities will do anything they can to squeeze the little guy to feed their unending greed.

Went to the Buffet here with a 2 for one coupon from American Casino Guide, the food is so so, Was a little disappointed they didn't have an omelet station. 
The price is decent though, but would come back if had a 2 for one coupon.

Staying at the Fiesta Henderson as we speak. I'm guessing all the bad reviews finally had an effect on this place. Every employee was very nice. The Fuego steak house meal was very good, the buffet was fabulous as is the Grand Cafe. The room I'm staying in is clean and comfortable. 
The reason I'm giving it two stars is the casino. I've never lost so much money so fast on the slots. I'm talking losing 100 bucks at dollar video poker in 10 minutes tops. Even at the 100% return machines. Horrible and I have two days to go! Never again! I really don't care about food or a nice staff when the casino is sucking me dry at light speed! If you come to eat, fine. If you come to gamble, your screwed. Peace.

It is what it is.  A cheap, convenient casino located well inside the quiet brother of Las Vegas, Henderson.  People coming here being disappointed are simply expecting to much.  It isn't located on the strip for a reason - its a locals hang out.

I come here to play the $3 table games (craps, roulette, blackjack), cheap bingo, and live keno.  It's some of the cheapest minimums in town, save for a few really sketchy casino halls.  And its still a station casino, so there is a morsel of standard here.  The drinks are also cheap, or free if you're playing and you can somehow find a cocktail waitress.

It's smokey.  It isn't pretty inside.  And some of the bars (Amigos) are staffed by bartenders who can only hope to open a beer without forgetting the recipe. 

But that being said - it's still a great place to gamble cheap on a late night when driving all the way into Vegas just seems too far.  It's also far larger than any of the other casinos located on this side of Henderson.

I enjoyed the free parking. This is an average casino. I am at caisnos for the buffets, mainly. The buffet here is just average, for about an average price. I do like that they have stations for different types of cuisine (American, Asian, etc.) 

Curiously enough, the jalapeno pizza was the best thing there. I tried a bit of most of the menu items.

It is a quieter place than downtown Las Vegas and I enjoyed that too during Casino GamePlay.
The hotel has been remodeled. The old carpet is gone and it has been painted and updated. The new buffet is awesome. Food prices are great. Still smoke smell in the air but it is ok.

It's an off-Strip, locals casino. Lower-end for sure. But it can still be fun! There's a movie theatre here. There's a small arcade area. Keno was fun. It has cheap tables. And the buffet is super cheap. So yeah, if you want to game and are feeling cheap, this is a fine enough place to do it.

Room: average , 2 queen sized beds, hot shower and clean sheets. Average, as I said. 

Pool: lame! No drink bar outside, you have to walk thru the casino in your swim suit to get to the nearest bar. Also you have to ask for towels at the registration desk. Dumb! Just put them outside in the pool area. 

Casino: I know it's Nevada and smoking is allowed, but it's so hazy! Better ventilation is definitely needed. 

20 minute drive to the strip as long as there's no traffic. 

All in all, I'd never come back here. If you look on groupon you can get tons of great deals for better hotels either on the strip or within walking distance. Spend the extra money for a nicer stay.

I DO NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. We recently (May 2014) stayed at the fiesta and upon checking out of our room my fiancee reached under his side of the bed to make sure nothing had fallen from the nightstand and was stabbed by a USED HYPODERMIC NEEDLE that someone had left in the room and housekeeping some how failed to notice it laying just a few inches under the bed. Due to the negligence of this hotel my fiancees health and well being has been compromised. I strongly suggest to think twice before booking a room here.
I love it here, it's small and quaint. STAR is the best cocktail server on the floor..

Review is specific to the Buffet.  Visited last night.  Had several items including the Mongolian BBQ.  Woke up in the middle of the night with a horrible case of food poisoning.  Been laying here all day unable to get out of bed for the most part and making trips to the bathroom all day.  

Food was marginal at best for a buffet.  Tried it because it was close to my house.  Won't go down that road again.

This was our first visit to the hotel and we were nothing but pleased. The hotel staff is extremely friendly and the room was well furnished and clean. Very convenient as we were not here for the strip experience but rather visiting family/friends that reside in Boulder City. The hotel parking lot is huge, always spots available and easy to navigate around. Starbucks, Subway, a buffet, and a Denny's like Cafe Fiesta are all downstairs. And not to mention a Regal theaters? We had an absolute wonderful visit, and the price was affordable. Definitely recommend, and would stay here again.

Horrible, Rude Service!!!  Use to really like this place but not anymore!

My husband and I went here the night before Thanksgiving.  It was pretty dead and we could not get any cocktail service.  Gambeled quite a bit but we must of been in the "no cocktail service section".  We finally moved to the left of the table games, near the door to exit.  Played for 30 minutes and a cocktail waitress FINALLY took our order.  BUT....here is where our experience gets worse.  45 minutes go by and the same cocktail waitress walks by us yelling "cocktails" and completely ignores us, and without delivery of our drinks...I then proceed to put away her $1.00 tip.  15 more minutes go by and still NO drinks and she walks by us again smiling while my husband waves and signals for her to come to us and while looking right at us she turns her back and walks away in the opposite direction. At this point we are to furious and we decide to leave.  I wish I would of have gotten her name.  She was a hispanic woman in her 30's or early 40's with hair above her shoulders.  What a way to ruin a holiday vacation.  WE WILL NEVER BE BACK to this casino again!!!  Our relatives who live in Vegas, Henderson and Boulder City are well aware of this situation and it has put a big negative on this casino for them!

Did not enjoy my stay here. As a casino I'm sure it's fine but as a hotel it's not that great. It's a cheap place and it shows. It's a bunch of little things they don't bother to spend money on. For example, they don't supply coffee in your room. That's no big deal I guess because they have a Starbucks on the casino floor. But you would then think they would have an entire staff working during the busiest part of the morning right? Nope, they had one person. My air conditioner wasn't working either. Again, small things by themselves but they all add up.

Update 10 min after posting: my TV stopped working.

Warning:  Do not, I repeat, stay here.  Here's why:
1.  Non-smoking room smelled like a smoking room. As soon as we walked in.  Smelled like weed.  Then find a lighter on the floor.  Front desk says they are sold out, so a room change is impossible.  They say they can send housekeeping to my room to spray and wipe down, but they never show up either.

2.  I ask the maid for extra towels, and she throws them into one big messy pile on the bathroom counter.

3. When maid came to clean the room, all she did was make 1 bed. We had 2 beds.  Left the other one unmade.  Extra pillows and bed cover for beds still on the floor and not placed back on made bed.  Lighter was still on the floor and room still  wreaked of the smoke smell.

4.  Called the front desk again the next day to speak to the manager, no manager on duty.  Clerk says he will email manager regarding my concerns and no follow up, phone call, contact whatsoever.  

Bottom line:  this place is horrible.  You have been warned.  I'd give it 0 's if I could!

What can I say bad after winning a cool "G". Older casino for sure, we went there a year or so ago and saw Foreigner, an outdoors venue but a Good setup and show, a good place to stop on the way out of town!
A bit seedy but the drinks are cheap and I won $40.00 bucks!!

I only play Pai Gow, to my disappointment on a Saturday night they had only 1 table open.  Even more disappointment, I just bought in, the pit boss told me they are trying to close the table.  And that minimum bet was $25.  Player on the table already was playing 5.  I usually play 10 and 5.  I immediately cashed my chips and left.  Dealer was extremely rude.  Pit boss was an idiot for chasing players away.  Will never come back to this casino ever again.

We stayed here over Mother's Day weekend while we were visiting family. A family member got us a King suite to stay in for 3 nights.

I think some of the negative reviews of this place are a little harsh. It's conveniently located off the freeway in Henderson, and although the rooms could use a little updating, everything was clean and satisfactory. They had decent sized flat screen tvs. The bed was a little lumpy/squishy for my preference, but I slept fine. 

There was no coffee maker in the room, but the king suite did include a bar area with a sink and mini fridge in the second "living room" area, which was huge! We also had a nice view of the Las Vegas strip from afar. 

The weird thing was that the rooms are connected to other guests' rooms on both sides by adjoining doors. I don't know if all the rooms were like that or just the king suites... I didn't hear our neighbors at any time except during one morning when I heard their alarm go off and then heard them go into the bathroom and take a shower. I was already awake though, and I never was kept up at night or woken up by our neighbors so it wasn't a huge deal to me.

I think people need to keep in mind that this is more of a budget-friendly hotel and casino. We appreciated the Starbucks and dining options inside. They also have a Regal movie theater, which we didn't get a chance to go to, but it's a nice additional amenity.
Good buffet.  Popular place for locals. Decent selection of games.

If I could give this place no Stars I would. It is the worst place to gamble. I was there for several hours on Thanksgiving and not one Machine hit a jackpot. There was literally no service people around which made since because the machines were not paying. I can honestly say I have never been to a casino where you never heard any bells go off indicating that someone had one. What a dive.... hopefully they will Bulldoze it Someday...

I stayed at this hotel over the cinco de mayo weekend for work and I woke up Sunday morning with over 40 bug bites all over my body.  I went to Urgent Care because I was getting really swollen and itchy.  I was very concerned because it was to the point where I had to be prescribed medicine.  When I called the hotel, I spoke to Rita at the front desk and I told her my situation asking if they could do a room check to see if there were any bugs around.  Although she was very apologetic and sincerely concerned about my situation, all she could do was transfer me to security.  When I was transferred, they just told me that they couldn't do anything unless if I file a complaint.  They also told me that if I want to file a complaint, I would have to be present at the hotel.  I live in California.  There is no way I'm driving all the way back just to put in a request for them to sweep the room for bugs, which is something they should be doing already for health and sanitary reasons. 
I have never had a problem with them from previous visits until this incident, and asking to look around for suspicious bug activity should not be a huge request.  In fact, for the benefit of a hotel who only has 2.5 stars, it should be their priority to treat their customers with sincerity and their rooms with cleanliness. 

NOTE: Pictures do not show ALL bug bites (for privacy reasons)
This place is awful. They told me to take my money and leave after I had a couple lucky hands at blackjack.

Its not glamorous, but it's not sub par either. the casino is alot bigger than you expected and the steakhouse and buffets are well above expectations. The room is generic, but clean. They do charge a resort fee like everyone else but this is one of the few places (Hard Rock, Palace Station also) that includes LONG DISTANCE calls from your room in the resort fee.....ya know in case you lose your cell phone in your drunken stuper.

It was a good deal and a nice stay

Big, nice, clean rooms that are cheap?  That's exactly what you get at Fiesta Henderson.  We just stayed from Saturday thru Thursday for just a little over $150 for the entire time.  Our room had 2 queen beds, was clean and had plenty of room.  The hotel & casino were nice, not overly fancy but nice.  The staff was very polite and helpful with anything we needed.

We ate a few meals at their buffet and one breakfast at the Denny's in the casino.  The buffet was middle of the road quality wise, but very cheap ($3.99 breakfast, $4.99 lunch and $5.99 dinner).  The food was decent, nothing spectacular but it was a decent meal each time.  For the price we paid it is hard to beat.

I will recommend this hotel to anyone I know going to Vegas.  It has to be the best bargain I've seen!

Decent place, they have a lot of stuff from gambling and hotel to food court and movie theater even an arcade. It's not to fancy but definitely not an of strip dive.  I often gamble here and the benefits from the players card don't hurt.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was a decent size with a decent view. Clean, Layout was nice. The only complaint I have as a guest of the hotel is the mattress. I know that I wasn't staying at the Ritz, but they could definitely invest in some better mattresses.

The Fiesta is a nice casino. Staff is very friendly. Really, I mean friendly. They were available to help us navigate the many machines as we aren't seasoned gamblers. Went for a fun night out with family.  We actually won $150. The casino was clean, as we're the bathrooms. If I had one complaint it would be that the drink staff was few and far between. They apologized for the long wait. Understandably it was a Sunday evening so I can see where there wouldn't be many scheduled to work. But it is a local destination and should have better staffing. Then on the flip side, the Fiesta caf√© at 1230am has the best pancakes I have ever eaten. They are no joke, hardcore delicious! Giant portions, comfort food yumminess. Staff was pleasant and accommoding. 2 full breakfast meals for under $20, where else can you get that. All in all we were pleased with our visit to the Fiesta casino and will definitely be back.

Not worth the money, that's for sure! 

I booked a month out and asked THREE times to make sure we were getting a NON-smoking room. But no, when we got there "we only have smoking rooms left". I was very unhappy! All my clothes, even the ones I didn't wear smell of smoke! I asked them to come spray and clean the room (because they suggested it) and it did nothing. 

The carpet was filthy, the bathroom was dimly lit, the sink kept plugging, the shower faucet drips, the window didn't open, and it took them 45 minutes to bring me up the extra blankets I called to request. The beds had a divot down the middle and made crinkling noises because there was some kind of plastic mattress cover under the sheets. 

When they maids "cleaned" the room, all they did was make the bed. I purposely placed a couple items around the room/bathroom to see if they got moved during the cleaning process - nope! They didn't even leave us new cups for the bathroom, or empty the dirty ashtray that I burned matches in trying to get rid of the stench of cigarettes! 

This place is not worth the price. The ONLY good thing about it was the pool area and the gift shop. 

The ONLY reason I didn't change hotels was because they'd already charged me a "holding fee" for the room they DID NOT give me.
I've done a little gambling here and did ok. I like the movie theater, that's pretty much why I go here. $2 bud or bud light and $1 hot dogs is sweet.

As I've said before, I'm a firm believer in you get what you pay for and you can't review a 35 dollar a night hotel like you expected it to be luxurious. This hotel is a good location for visiting our family who lives in green valley, and we picked it because of the price and the fact that they allow dogs (we found out during the stay that dogs will no longer be allowed in 2016). That said, we probably wouldn't stay again once the new dog policy goes into effect and would stay at a dog friendly hotel or sunset station instead, which is similar price and a much nicer hotel.

I hope you are reading this before you even think about calling this hotel for a reservation. DO NOT COME HERE TO STAY OVERNIGHT! So, I had the room booked by my sister because it's an "affordable hotel". I looked online and it honestly didn't even look too bad! So we drive in to the hotel and everything on the outside is completely outdated. We walk inside and okay I see a basic little casino, but again extremely outdated. So we go up to our bedroom... another thing outdated! No fridge, No Microwave, No coffee machine, Not even a simple Bible in the drawer (which these are things that I've had in EVERY ROOM I ever stayed in!) The window will not even open in the slightest bit. The bathroom has NO FAN OR AIR VENT. The toilets look so disgusting you don't even want to sit on them. As soon as we turned on the air-conditioning vent it smelt heavily of cat urine and it did the whole two days I was there it still smelt! So we go onto sleeping in the bed... HARD AS A ROCK! And the pillows were too! The air conditioning vent wouldn't even work properly so we sweat... all night. I'm so upset we payed for two nights at this place. I hope you never have to go to this hotel. It's a vacation ruiner.

We stayed for 3 nights and we will not be returning. Rooms are super small and old. The hallways smell like windex and chemicals. The restaurant service was horrible and the waitress was rushing us and we felt like we were inconveniencing her when we asked for simple things like napkins and ketchup.

Had a Station's perk coupon for a very good room rate & used it for a guest. Have had friends stay at Sunset & GVR which were both very nice. This guest had a pet & so had to book at Fiesta Henderson. Not quite as bad as the likes of the 4 Queens on Fremont,  but not far off. Low ceilings, view of the HVAC system out the 2nd story window. No coffee, hot water took 10 minutes. Bed linens were fine but the whole floor reeked of smoke though it was a non smoking room. Noisy, ALL night long. I won't be booking my guests there again, even if they are the only Station that is pet friendly. Pet friendly shouldn't put you in the sub par rooms/views. Pet owners often have a ton of money & class. Perhaps this should be considered by Station casino management.

Two words:  BED BUGS. Stayed here for a weekend during November 2015, and we could not believe the terrible experience.  Bites all over...  Emailed the hotel management about the incident.  Radio silent.  Casino & restaurants were fine.  Just avoid sleeping here.

The Cafe at the Fiesta in Henderson was a very good experience this time around!!!  If you want chinese food......this is the place to go!!!!  The Mongolian Beef is excellent, Orange Peel Chicken...excellent, War Won Ton Soup...excellent and the Chicken Egg Rolls and Pot Stickers are Unbelievably Delicious!!!!!!  Never expected great chinese food at a cafe....but whoever does the chinese cooking here....should get a raise!!!!  And it's reasonably priced!  I'll be back this weekend!!!!  :)

Well you get what you pay for I guess. First, upon getting to our room we found a disabled smoke detector sitting on the bathroom counter with a handwritten note saying "needs a new battery". That battery and note stayed there for the entire weekend, with no room attendant or maintenance member bothering to fix it. I can only wonder how long it's been there. Maybe they were expecting us to provide the batteries and reattach it to the bedroom ceiling? We also didn't have a shower curtain for the first few nights of the stay, but it mysteriously reappeared the last night we were there. Beware- walls are also paper thin and you can hear every conversation and sound in the hallways and neighboring rooms loud and clear. Ew. Added one star for the dirt cheap Roulette table minimum, which was probably the only plus.

I only got a chance to check out the casino portion of this property one time several years back, while I was visiting Green Valley Ranch just down the road.

A bit smaller than some of the other Station properties, but the overall layout was very similar.

The only reason I can't give it a five star rating is because at the time, they seemed to require having a separate, property-specific player's card, despite the fact that it's in the Station chain.

This establishment has gone down hill. The rooms were filthy.  They didn't give us the room we booked and had conformation on,  We ate in the coffee shop and were 1 of 3 tables in their but still received horrible service. I think it is a shame that Stations is celebrating there 40th anniversary and instead of focusing on customer service they really didn't care.  It makes me wonder why?  Maybe they have unhappy employees Hmmm? Perhaps there is poor moral? I would never recommend you stay here.

JUNE 17, 2017, minus zero, for the wait staff at the buffet, ESPECIALLY R**Y....(don't ever leave a tip ahead of time...which we didn't do, thank goodness).  

A buffet is self serve affair so the only thing the wait staff really has to do is get drinks, clear the table and ask how you are, zero on all counts with this idiot, R**y.

R**Y completely shunned us and we dont know why...R**Y waited on everyone around us, so obviously he didn't give a shit...he should be fired, immediately!

We watched him make at least 30 trips to the kitchen with dirty buffet plates, passing us by each time WITHOUT STOPPING ONCE.

WE SPOKE WITH a lovely manager named Barbie who witnessed this insanity, who kept saying, "R**y has never done this!"  That is a "fail" comment as R**y demonstrated bias right under her nose!  She told us she will pull the videotape and watch his full actions. 

UPDATE:  JUNE 19, 2017
We ended up with 2 free dinners, and this waitress came over in 1 minute to take our drink order.  Thank you, Mary.

This hotel is for folks on a budget looking for a room with the basics. It served its purpose for our trip and would recommend it to someone who isn't looking for all the bells and whistles. I saw pizza, subway and fatburger plus movie theater, bars and lots of slot machines. Didn't do much in the hotel besides sleep. Fatburger tasted horrible and took forever.
Take a Motel 6, make it 10 stories high, add a casino and buffet, and VOILA! - you have this property. Hotel adds ten dollar per night resort fee to your Expedia reservation, which is dishonest..

Pros:  Desserts are muy delicioso!  (most buffet desserts taste like cardboard).

Cons:  you have to ask the lady for the dessert you want.  Yes, I want the Boston creme pie AND a brownie AND the red velvet cupcake please.

Con #2: our 30 minute wait to be seated AFTER we paid.   This place is seriously understaffed.  

Verdict: for a buffet, decent food, shockingly good desserts, horrible wait=not worth $10.99.
Okay walked around here a bit before our movie, lay outs nice clean not busy. Write more later did not stay here just cause I use to be a local and this is a locals type thing.

Pretty Cool local Casino to play at, except for you do have your regulars that come in and just stay drunk,and hover around you from time to time at the tables. And they might ask you a strange question or two...YIKES...and you also have the option to make convenient sports bets at will. But on another note,This buffet is a decent buffet,I would say a little bit better than average. But Being a Vegan, and all the salad bars I have hit,this is by far NOT a top 25 salad bar in Vegas in my Yelping opinion. They are a few Veggies short of being a top 25 salad bar, LOL...if they add a few more salad bar options then maybe they will make 25 on my Vegan salad bar list...question is will I ever go back??? "MAYBE"if they add more options to the salad bar,or if they're like the last Salad bar in Vegas left to serve a hungry Vegan...lol!!!

A little gem outside Vegas on the way to Arizona. Fairly cheap hotel with a large casino area. It was quiet when we stayed there but we noticed there is also a movie theater for added entertainment. Room was clean, just the pillows weren't super comfy. No breakfast included in the room but there is a convenient Starbucks on property.

Went here with my sister and aunt.. worse slots  would hit bonuses  and didn't get a penny. Rediculious. . I was in town visiting  my godfather so when I saw the godfather slot it was a must. WRONG.. how you can hit  3 bonus spins and get nothing is rediculious  and don't order a drink while playing because you will never get it. Which seems to be the vegas theme everywhere. But after numerous  attempts to get a drink and a few hours later I got a very delious Bloody Mary or maybe it just seemed that way since I waiting so long.

It's like a fucking motel, get new employees. They treat you like shit. Even better you have to yell at them employees to get attention or better yet give you good service. Please don't come here or better yet if your lost and brainless this is the place for you.

We stayed 2 nights. While this is an older hotel, it seemed to be clean. Upon arriving to our room I checked the bed & surrounding areas for bed bugs as I have heard the stories about hotel rooms. I didn't look hard enough or just missed them all together. The first night I was bit 4 times on my chest and the second night 9 times on my back. Had I realized they were bed bug bites after the first night I would have left. After being home for almost a week I have had no further bites and hope we didn't bring any home with us. While I had no issues with the staff I will never return to this Station property

Zero how sad, I'm here right now I can't believe what I'm seeing awful! With the talent in Vegas this place SUX ! I'm  a Veteran wow this is the best you could do super SLAP IN THE FACE  thx Stations sux my time super wasted!

Their customer service is very good.  Bartenders are very greedy and thankless.  Many times after tipping 100.00 after a jackpot you rarely get a thank you.  They don't know you just broke even for the day.  Makes me not want to tip anymore.  Why is it always expected?  I hate to stiff.  Never get a tip when you lose, which is usually the case.

My husband and I travel and are on the road a lot, and this is by far the worst hotel we've stayed in. The non-smoking room smelt HORRIBLE. Like dead animals guys, I'm not even kidding. My husband took apart the AC unit thinking something was dead in there. The showers were awful, no water pressure and the water kept getting super cold.. and then really hot! Sheets were old and well used, same with the pillows and towels. Breakfast was a total mislead. They made you think you can get a $3.99 breakfast.. my husband and I sit down and start to order and that price is for player cards only. Which is completely free at the front desk, no one informed us that you have to have that card for all the special prices for the hotel. We were unable to leave the restaurant to get these cards once we realized (from the rude waitress) that you needed these cards for the special price, which was not advertised anywhere. We paid $25 for a terrible breakfast. DO NOT STAY HERE. We left the next morning, complaining, the staff could careless.

Non existent payouts. Impossible to win.

Folks don't be fooled. This place and others like it exist for two reasons.

Somewhere for gambling addicts to go to lose their money.

Overflow for tourists when the strip hotels are booked or high priced. 

No tourist in their right mind would stay or play here if they had a choice of staying on the strip.

Like another reviewer stated, they need to be investigated by the Nevada Gaming Commission. Station casinos cheat and their payouts are below the minimum threshold.

House keeping stole from my wife a very expensive bottle of perfume. And the tub backed up with sewage while trying to take a shower at 1:00 in the morning and they did nothing. Security director is the one to talk to about the theft, and he has been out for the past 5 days and I have been told to call tomorrow each day. I recommend you stay in and eat out of a dumpster than this septic tank.

Here is another local casino that we gamble at and of course don't stay at either.  When we go here, it''s either food or gambling.  I like the slots here (I don't know if it's looser than others) and the tables aren't bad.  Their Festival Buffet isn't bad either.

Gross!   I have been to a few other Station casinos and this is probably the worst!  I this is the second worst place I've slept in my life.   The room smelled horrible, a smoke and foul smell. The sheets felt awful.  I literally felt dirtier leaving this hotel.  The buffet had horrible service, old food and dirty tables. Do yourself a favor and don't stay here!

At first it seemed as though the Fiesta hotel might be a great place to stay because of recommendations and the low price, but it is definitely some place I wouldn't stay anytime in the near future unless they changed a few things.
* Better service - many of the staff were not accommodating nor friendly
* Cleaner rooms/hotel in general - the carpet was filthy and rooms weren't cleaned well
* More things for kids to do
* Clearer rules and amenities - they say Internet is complimentary in the rooms, but desk staff say it costs a certain amount per day and no room coffee
* Better food - actual hotel food wasn't good, but Subways, Villas, Starbucks was good
* Cheaper ATM fees - $3.75 is way too expensive to be pulling money out of an ATM
Our room wasn't ready when we arrived to check in, but all of our friends who arrived before/around the same time we did had rooms ready. They told us to check a later to see if a room was ready. Another person, who arrived later than us, was given the room we had wanted, which was right across from our friends. They then proceeded to give us the very last room in the hall, but everyone else from our group on that floor was towards the front of the hall. Eventually, they conceded us a room about a quarter of the way from the end of the hall.
When another of our friends arrived with her family, they were given rooms on the floor above us. All three of those rooms smelled like cigarette and cigar smoke. The underside of the comforters in our friend's room was dirty; and after getting help from the maid to remove all the linens and spray the room with air freshener, they found the smell tolerable enough for the night. They gave her a different set of rooms on the Seventh Floor when all of us were on the 2nd floor.
We were there for an event and needed a space to practice because none of the rooms were large enough to be a suitable dance space. So, another member of the group talked with the desk people and the manager to see if there was some way to get a room or another place to practice. None of them were of any help. They said they couldn't unlock any of the meeting rooms. Luckily, we discovered that the pool area was large enough to practice. 
On the second day, the pool was closed without any notification prior to our arrival. The only notification we received was a letter from the hotel stating the pool would be closed all day Saturday and that arrived somewhere around 11pm Friday night. It turned out that the pool had been closed for a wedding reception. And since we were using the space to practice, we couldn't practice. A lot of our group had been planning on leaving Sunday, and many of them had young children who had been looking forward to the pool now had nothing to do and most of them left the hotel to find a suitable activity for their children.
Our group director tried to get a comp night for us because of the closed pool and the hotel staff's refusal to accommodate our need for a room, but the manager wouldn't give the comp night. Our director was able to get us a $20 food discount per room. But because much our group had planned to check out on Sunday, many of them were not able to take advantage of this.
A few of us tried to take advantage of the discount by going to the buffet. However, they told us that in order to split our group of 8 people into three groups we would not be guaranteed tables near each other. So, we had to dish out $30. The food at the buffet ranged from good to okay to bad. A lot of it was dried out, hard as a rock, or covered with too much sauce. 
Although there is an arcade, a movie theatre, and a pool available to the kids, the arcade was tiny and half of the machines in the arcade were broken and the movie theatre wasn't showing any movies that didn't interest any of the kids and the pool was closed for an entire day. Kids weren't even allowed to stand by the post in front of the reception desk because it was too close to the machines. The entrances to the hotel should not have slot machines 5 feet from the entrance because there is nowhere for kids to wait if they are waiting for their parents to check in.
The air conditioner in our room was noisy and the remote to set for auto start/auto off was broken. The seal on the bottom of our tub was almost gone and there were stains on the wall; one of the rooms had a broken ironing board and no iron, which was greatly needed; and, the door of another was not straight and made the door difficult to open.

I wish I could give this place less stars. Let's start with the non-smoking rooms, they reek of smoke. What about their table drink service, it's non-existent on a Saturday! It literally took our table 30 minutes to get a drink of water because all the waitresses were laid off.
The straw that broke the camel's back though was Fiesta's shady 'ATM' cash skimming machines. I tried to use those AtM machine 5 different times in the early morning of a NCAA tournament weekend. Instead of telling me ' insufficient funds' or ' you're wrong!' I kept getting an error message telling me to remove my debit card. At NO TIME did the ATM machine tell me, ' oh by the way we're going to charge you $2,50 on top of your regular bank out of network me withdrawal fee'.  This happened 5 TIMES! With $0
Withdrawan. This ended with $7.50 in ATM withdrawal fees with $0.00 given from their super exclusive ATM machine.

Don't get me started on their shitty 'hot tub'.

How is a casino buffet gonna charge full price for a child that will barely eat anything? They must be hurting in their wallet to be doing that. Absolute bull shit. 
Hopefully the food is good... Maybe, I'll be able to understand why they would charge full price for a toddler.  

So far our server is very friendly. So for her, she gets five stars, but the initial service at the front counter, sad..

Food was ok, still think kids should at least be only half price.

This review is for the casino only. 

We used to play here all the time and had so much fun and then we started to notice the  changes in the machines. It started gradually and then over the past several years this casino dwindled down to a very boring place to gamble. As I said it used to be so much fun but they took out all their fun machines and changed them out to either low payouts or no payouts (especially those money sucking penny machines!). And some of the old machines they left have been "tweaked" (I believe that's the word a casino host from another casino once used to describe to me what they do to their machines on occasion.) Lots of casinos, well probably all of them are doing this but not as repulsive as this place. And where did all the fun video poker machines that were on the floor go? You can only fool people for so long. And this is why people don't gamble as much anymore.
