I love Fiesta Henderson! They are freaking fantastic. Homey, fun, local friendly, more of an older crowd &/or family friendly vibe. We stayed here to visit our grandparents in Henderson & I felt like we were surrounded by other adoptive grandparents here at the casino the entire time.

The rooms are clean, nice, quiet. I just loved it. 

I also loved the buffet & food located in the casino, & such good prices. I would definitely stay here again.

Things are getting better. Amy strenger (the casino host) called me. Invited me to meet and greet with the GM. I also got comped dinner and free slot play. Thank you Amy! This was exactly what I needed. I appreciate everything you've done. We'll be returning as usual.  
-Margarita F.

Casino near empty this morning so we moved around to dozens of slots. Tightest ever.  Example: 30 free games on one - total bonus win was $3.95.  On the diamonds game (like cherries on fire but diamonds) my bet was $1.50 and on a 10 spin bonus I won less than $5 .not returning.

My fianc√©e and I had a date night at the buffet. It was small but cozy. The food selection wasn't the greatest, but it was ok. The cashier didn't ask if we wanted alcohol when we went to pay, which I thought was standard procedure at all casino buffets. Our waitress wasn't very attentive to our needs, as far as refilling our drinks. We had to flag her down once, and another time we had to flag down another waiter. Subpar service. I doubt we will be back to this buffet again.

I come to the Fiesta Henderson for three reasons.

1) $8 movie tickets any time
2) the buffet w/my bogo coupon
3) Amigos (closed;make that 2 reasons)

I don't know how a casino named the Fiesta can close the mexican restaurant inside its casino. I went to go eat at Amigos this last Saturday night to fill my woman up w/tacos and margaritas, but NOOOOOOOOOO... These rat bastards officially are closed. The buffet was closed. All they have at the food court is a pizza spot, Fatburger, and I cant remember, I think a subway.

And the sportbook sucks. Wow that crap is horrible. All the stations casinos are getting made over, except the Fiesta.

The gaming is great as i enjoy playing here. Wish there were more of a variety of newer games. Staff seems good. Some cocktail waitresses are oblivious.  The cafe is not that great. Ate there and sat at the counter at 1 am one time and watched my food sit under the hot lights for 15 minutes as my waitress was no where to be found.  Next time i sat at a booth and if it wasn't for the guy who sat me to come back and take my order i might still be sitting there.  I saw my waitress only once.  Haven't tried any other restaurant yet.  Ate at the buffet once and that was enough. Couldn't use my points to pay because the system was down. Unacceptable if you ask me.

Do Not Waste your time here. The most hostile and sad casino I have ever been to. Like the opening casino scene in Tombstone, with Billy Bob Thornton. It appears that every blackjack player at the 5 dollar table was betting to save their life or at least to get some money for their six kids to eat. Sad really, I only play to have fun and lose money. Part of the experience. These lonely losers are angry: from the fat, scruffy white guy in mossy oak camo(It blows my mind why anyone would wear camo in a casino), to the tattooed native American/mexican looking mutt mix with pony tail and hat. These poor people need to win to survive. I will never be back to this sad and pathetic place. You get a better vibe at a gas station.

Gamble here at your own risk! This is my third time staying here for a local event and this is the worst casinos I have been too. Most of the gamblers are local elderlys and I promise you NO ONE IS A WINNER!! The only good thing about this place is the $3 minimum black jack table. Slots are super tight and will eat your money. At other casinos I  usually win some lose some but my goodness.. you can literally go days at the Fiesta Henderson without getting a decent win. Stay here fine but gamble here and you will lose all your money in no time.

Very overpriced ($139/night on weekends, plus extra fees and taxes), and less than stellar rooms that reek of old stale smoke.  Rooms are very outdated, walls are paper thin so bring ear plugs and pray your neighbors are considerate enough to not let their kids run amok at 7am if you want to sleep in!  No coffee in room so you are forced to go down through the casino area to buy overpriced coffee at the indoor Starbucks.  No room service option (that I could find), and no fridge or anything to keep anything cold.  The Fuego restaurant in house was great though!  Delicious food and great service!
The Saturday champagne brunch includes shrimp at Mongolian grill and lots of it plus all the champagne you can drink. The petite Asian server is the best.

Came here expecting to get a decent nonsmoking room, but found that prices surged even though the person over the phone told me if I checked in earlier than usual, it would be another extra $15 or $50 (I must've misheard but it was either $15 or $50). Checking in early ended up being another $135 along with our reservation (64$)  and we got a smoking room (no other non smoking rooms were available) even though the person over the phone told me many rooms were available. The smoky room was terrible. I barely got any sleep and coughed a lot, but had no choice but to stay there. Extremely dissatisfied with this place. It's pretty mediocre. Starbucks downstairs is pretty nice, but the staff over the phone just doesn't communicate well. Also just read a review that someone got bedbugs. I'm just so disgusted and hope I didn't get bedbugs. Never coming back!

I was sport betting approx. $3,000.00 a day between here and the GVR until the sports book ticket writers began to be rude and impolite at the counter.  I guess they thought the Fiesta could afford to lose some business.  But, sarcasm is the rule in Vegas not the exception.  So, no-don't stay or play here.  A good alternative is the Homewood Suites (a Hilton property) on Eastern Ave.  10 minutes to the Strip and McCarren.  No resort fees...no long elevator rides...no long walk from the parking garage plus you can get a hugh room with a full kitchen and earn Hilton Honors Points at the same time.  Also, just south of Mandalay Bay off Russell Rd. about 5 or 6 chain hotels are located within easy proximity to the airport and Strip.  Just google street view of this area.  No way can you be long hauled by your cab ride to this location either.  Fiesta is too far from the strip and driving in a rental car is awkward  for someone that is unfamiliar with the area and it is not recommended.  It's about a $70.00 cab ride to Fiesta.

There was nothing really great about it.  Just a casino. We stopped in there because on our yelp, it said there was an El Torito in the area.  Well it wasn't in there.  
I'm sure you can enjoy yourself here at this casino just like the rest of them around town.    You might even win somethng because it's a local casino!

The Fiesta is a good local casino.  I've never stayed in the hotel, just the casino and some of the restaurants/buffet so this review excludes the hotel itself.

This is one of the middle to lower end casinos within the Station Casinos chain.  The advantage here is that the gambling benefits a better than at their other properties.  If you are a regular player, then you are likely to get into the bonus drawing for their frequent players club.

I like to play the table games here because of the low minimum bets they allow, $5 at most tables almost all of the time.

The buffet is adequate.  It is not the best in Vegas and Vegas is known for its great buffets.  However, the buffet is fairly cheap and there is a good variety of food:  American, Chinese, Mongolian grill, Italian, Mexican.  Get a cup of the clam chowder when you go!

I think the hotel is nice. The rooms are descent. Theres not much to do other than gamble and play in the arcade. You could eat and watch a movie if you wanted to. Your close to lake mead from this hotel. Your also right next to a main freeway

The cafe is good.  The tables are
 Fine... but the hotel is absolutely awful. Fire alarm went off at 5 am. But not in my room. Good thing it was just smoke from a different floor... but since I was up and hear something faint in the hall way we were able to get out in case it was a major fire. They let someone with a dog next door. Dog barked at paper thin walls for hours... Till like 2 in the am

The buffet suffered from poor staffing and very mediocre food when we went there today. Next to the "food" that the Circus Circus buffet slops out, this was the poorest buffet I have tried here in Las Vegas. Poorly layed out with deserts in the middle .  It took the server 3 trips to bring the cream for the coffee. Then one bright spot was the ground up Butter Fingers for topping the ice cream. Will not be coming back here.
Always a fun time. Their table games are affordable. We're treated the same a high rollers even when we are making the minimum bet. Awesome staff.

The food at the buffet was uh, passable.. The gal that insisted we get a players card was sweet, and the attendant came to us, so that was really cool. Again I wish the food had been better. Not sure I will have a reason to come back..

Love this place! Perfect place to stay away from the strip. Great food options... Starbucks inside.... wonderful buffet. Terrific prices and staff and good location if you want to be away from the strip. Right off the freeway.

For the cheap price, I wasn't expecting to get much from this hotel. We originally had a reservation to stay here for five nights over 4th of July weekend. However, our stay was cut short. Immediately when we arrived at the room, the room was extremely hot, as the AC had been off. We turned on the AC then left for the evening. When we returned around 10pm the room was still very hot and the AC was off again, so we turned it back on and got in bed. About 10 minutes later the AC turned off, with the room still hot. We quickly realized what was happening. Our AC refused to stay on and we were about to suffer through a long night of getting up every 10 minutes to turn the AC back on until we could fall asleep, and then wake up sweating in the morning in our hot room. It was horrible. On top of all that, the AC is VERY loud and the front desk informed us that the hotel was sold out for the weekend, so switching rooms was not a possibility. With 110 degree whether outside, it is unacceptable for a hotel to not have functioning AC. 

The next night we canceled the rest of our reservation and switched over to the Holiday Inn. I just wish we had gone there first.

Fiesta's cafe seems to be getting worse when I consider the last two visits. Took friends here two weeks ago and our greeting from Arianne  (or whatever?) when we were seated was to tell us we'd have a long wait as she looked exasperated and walked away. After 15 minutes she returned with a piss poor attitude and took our orders. The food was pretty much an embarrassment to feed to people we brought here.  She was very snippy and after looking at other reviews and photos I see this must be her normal approach. Today we came by for breakfast and it came out within a couple of minutes but cold & salty hash browns on both our plates prompted us to ask for country potatoes instead to go with our over cooked scrambled eggs. Even worse so I'd have to say don't bother driving here as a local, it's cheap but not even worth eating if it were free!

This casino is great if you know what to expect.  Granted, I've never stayed in the hotel or eaten there, but I appreciate the drinks, staff, theater, and pretty much everything I've experienced there.  The movie theater has great prices, is clean, sells overpriced beer, and is never crowded.  Again, as long as you're not expecting the Bellagio, or even Green Valley Ranch, this place is great for locals, is conveniently located, and a good place to relax Aftr work without spending a ton of money... would I eat at the buffet there ? Being a Chef, and one of the opening team at Bacchanal, most likely not; but that's not what I go there for, and I'm sure it's good for the price..

First of all, the buffet is so gross and everything looks awful. The service is horrible and the food looks like it has been sitting out all day. I hardly ate much and just sipped on my drink. When I went the restroom, I saw 3 employees go the restroom and then leave. Then worked in the buffet and how gross. They didn't wash their hands that is so nasty. You don't even realize how much I wanted to throw up after seeing that. This casino is very sketchy and I would not let anybody come here. Save your self the trouble and go to Green Valley so much better than this horrible disaster.

In one word I can sum this poor excuse for a hotel...DUMP.  It's awful and there is really no excuse for how old, run down and just grimy this place is.  The guest rooms are awful too.  Sure it's better than sleeping in the car but not by much.

If I had read some of these reviews, we might not have stayed here, but it was close to family so we booked it for a 4 day weekend in April. Easy access, right off the highway. No traffic problems.
   The hotel and casino, inside and out, was very clean. Check in was quick and our special request for a room on lower floor levels was fulfilled. Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable. All of the staff were pleasant and helpful. The Rewards Center ladies explained special promos and veterans discounts to me and my wife.
   Plenty of slots and tables to play, loose enough to keep my wife playing for hours. Music in casino was great, not too loud, no hip hop or Justin Beber, mostly tunes from the 60's & 70's.
   Drink service in casino was alittle slow, not enough waitresses, but once they found us, they checked on us every half hour.
   Breakfast special for under $5, fantastic !! Great service too.

   Thanks Fiesta Henderson for making our stay FANTASTIC !!

These casinos are about cheap food, entertainment and the 1655 slot machines, 25 table games and 5 poker tables, plus race and sports book.
--------------------
This Fiesta is in much better shape than the Fiesta on Rancho RD

Review for casino only:

I've been to the Fiesta Henderson many times, mostly before there were other Station casinos of better quality and nearer to home.  I like their coffee shop and the Mexican place was very good.

Unfortunately, now I use the Fiesta as a place to meet up with friends when we go hiking.  You don't know how easy it is to just say, "Meet me under the big Fiesta sign out front."  No one misses that!  Well, there was the time that a friend went to the Fiesta Rancho and totally missed the sign.

I stopped here Monday to meet hiking friends and I went in to use the bathroom before leaving on our great hike.

One of these days, I'll return to the Fiesta for some food and play and give this place the better review it deserves.

This is about the Fiesta Henderson Hotel but I can't find where it has gone and it's only showing the steakhouse now. I didn't try the steakhouse so I don't know how it is, but here is my hotel experience. Where to begin, when we arrived it was very hard to figure out where to actually check in. Then we were told by two different people two different things about the pet fee, one said one time fee another said 35 per day, also we were told by housekeeping manager that each room had a coffee maker in them but when we got there were told if we wanted one we had to pay 20 a day for it! When we checked in we were not given a recipient told we would get it at the end of the trip then when we checked out we were still not given a recipient saying everything was already taken care of. A couple days after we got a bill on our account of 310, when we made the reservations on Expedia it was a total of 269. I know there are hotel fees but even with them it wouldn't add up to 310. So we called their front desk and Debbie told us what she thinks happen is they went back and took out the third party discount and added their weekend fee. So I have repeatedly tried to call Kristen, one of their managers, and she has yet to answer or call me back. Never staying at this hotel ever again l. If any of you do and book with a third party make sure to get a recipient no matter what and keep a very close eye on your account after Incase this happens to you.

Need a room for the night?  This isn't a bad place to stay. Super cheap.  Bed was comfortable.  Could have been more cleanly ie random piece of plastic on floor, three inch long hair in tub.  No light bulb in one of the lamps.   Good theater and food establishments.  This place is a mixed bag.
Nice pool, but my daughter slipped.  She needed four stitches.  Went to security.  I got a band-aid.  Was surprised that they did not even do a report.
We had our personal belongings removed. I filed a complaint and have not received any further information. I would recommend you watch your back.

Fiesta Henderson is a perfect example of getting what one pays for. It's an older hotel & casino, with very few bells and whistles but it gets the job done for people that need an inexpensive place to sleep and shower while in Las Vegas. Fiesta is part of the Station Casino chain, which recently started the 'We Love Locals' program, so every week they offer a different deal for me to take advantage... 

Since I live in Henderson, when out of town visitors ask me what inexpensive hotel they should stay at that is near me, I recommend Fiesta. Yes, they have a resort fee. MOST Vegas hotel and casinos do these days. Even with the resort fees, rooms here are very inexpensive. 

My mother in law recently stayed at Fiesta and I was with her when she checked it. The employee that helped her was pleasant, even when my MIL questioned the resort fees. She also gave my MIL a sheet with coupons she could use for free slot play, and then when she was sitting at a nearby machine another employee stopped to make sure she was doing everything correctly to get her free play. 

A month later, my mom stayed here for a long weekend. She checked in without me but every time I went to Fiesta to meet up with her, employees were saying hello and telling me to have a nice visit. Employees here are very friendly and helpful, and not in the 'I am just doing this because it is my job' kind of way. 

The rooms are basic but they get the job done. I noticed housekeeping putting newspapers outside every room when I was there on Saturday morning, apparently this is one of the things that the resort fee pays for but unlike some Strip casinos they actually bring it to you, which I thought was nice. There is a small pool and spa to relax in, a cheap buffet and a movie theater. 

Both my mother and mother-in-law were happy with their stays at Fiesta. And if a place can make both of them happy, it makes me happy. 

If you visiting the Henderson area and just need an inexpensive place to sleep that is ran by friendly employees, Fiesta will get the job done. Don't go into it expecting a 5 star experience and you shouldn't be disappointed...

Fiesta is just okay. And when I mean okay, I'm not necessarily sending my out of town friends/family to Fiesta for the Las Vegas experience.  Really not much at this casino.  It's small, it's very smokey, and there's really not much to eat here. But they have slots and everyone loves slots.  Everybody that gambles, that is. I haven't done much gambling or even eating here, but have started to frequent this place strictly for their sports book.  I'm at this side of town almost weekly and find that Fiesta is one of the more convenient locations to place a quick football wager.  Parking is easy and the casino usually isn't busy.  There...The End.

This is for the hotel only.  My only experience with the casino was walking through it and it looked like most other casinos.

I booked two hotel rooms via Priceline a month before my stay for myself, my brother and his teenage daughter.  Via Priceline, I requested a 2-star hotel (think Super 8 or Rodeway Inn) for $35.00/night and was pleased when I was upgraded to a 2 1/2 star hotel, the Fiesta Henderson Station.  I didn't have previous experience with a Station hotel, but my brother has stayed in several Station hotels in the Vegas area and said his previous experiences were uniformly good.  Not this time. 

Two weeks before our stay, I called the hotel to request adjoining rooms, at least one with two beds for my brother and niece.  The woman on the phone was not very helpful, saying we should call Priceline.  I told her Priceline policy was to deal with the hotel directly, something I've done many times in the past.  She went ahead and took my request, but said she couldn't guarantee that my request would be fulfilled.  I figured two weeks should have been ample time to work my simple request into their system.  

We arrived on a Monday evening in mid-June for a two night stay.  The parking lot was maybe 25% full and the casino was not crowded, yet when we got to the front desk, we were told that not only could we not have adjoining rooms, we couldn't even have rooms on the same floor because "We're sold out tonight."  This was a blatant lie - there were not enough people in the corridors or on the elevator or cars in the parking lot for them to be sold out.  We had to wonder what they would have told a family with small children.  The desk clerk's attitude, while not rude, was definitely unhelpful and unapologetic.  It was quite obvious that he dealt with angry, frustrated or disappointed customers often because of the hotel's crappy customer service policies (as I saw during another exchange with another guest the next day.)  In addition, the hotel required a credit card authorization of $100 for incindentals, not just a card on file, tying up $100 in your account.

The room, while not dirty, was on the shabby side.  It was a "smoking optional" room (I was told there were no non-smoking rooms available.) and smelled of cigarettes (as did the corridor.)  The air conditioner was very noisy  - and because it's Vegas in the summer, had to run continuously.  The furniture, while serviceable, was scuffed and beat up and one of the lights didn't work.  The tub was a jacuzzi tub, but when it was turned on, foul-smelling water came through the jets, indicating it hadn't been cleaned or maintained and probably wasn't sanitary.  

Finally, on check-out, we were assessed a $10.00 plus tax "service fee" for use of the hotel's services.  When my brother questioned the fee, he was told it was for use of the hotel's services, such as Wi-Fi, even though neither of us used anything other than the TV - not the phone, not the Wi-Fi, not the premium movie channels, nothing.  This was not disclosed at check-in and to my mind is blatant theft.  These fees should be included in the initial rates or disclosed at check-in.

To be fair, the hotel wasn't all bad.  Except for the front desk people, who were not very polite or helpful, the rest of the staff seemed pretty nice.  We had breakfast at the buffet and the food was decent and the price ($5.99) was fair.  (They offer a $2.00 discount if you join the Players Club, but it wasn't worth the hassle, since we knew we'd never stay there again.)  Everything worked, but it was outdated and   not well maintained.  My biggest complaints are with the poor attitude of the desk staff, the low priority of their customer service policies and the policy on incindentals.  I will not be returning.

Went to the buffet, some lizard's tail fell of from the ceiling and was straight down hitting the table. Thought it was so disgusting. The food at the buffet are gross, definitely should be lower than one star. Over all hotel is alright, so 2 stars is the best it deserves.

The newest Fiesta property, since this was formerly the Reserve casino (fun jungle theme). A smaller property in Henderson, located right off the 95 freeway
but then again, there are not many large casinos on this side of town with the exception of Sunset Station and Green Valley Ranch casino. 

Here's a list of Pros:
-least smoky in henderson because the smaller ones nearby are very old, in comparison

-newer garage on the side of the casino- lots of parking now 

-movie theater, nice addition to the property- pretty big, too

-cafe is pretty good, but better than the buffet, which is alright (it's better for brunch)

If you want something better, I'd recommend driving to the M Resort, a large, but beautiful property with a better buffet, floral-scented lobby, and a reasonable gelato place.
It's an ok casino.  However it is not on the strip, so it will be quieter. Generally will see more locals than tourists here.  Always have seen friendly staff, and food has been good.

I made a hotel reservation online at Fiesta Henderson and within minutes cancelled. The AC went out at my home and I figured they wouldn't be able to fix it until Monday (this is on Saturday night). This is the worst hotel/casino I've ever stayed.  First of all the bed was really uncomfortable.  Second, there was no hot water at 3am.  Third, the food was nasty. Over all the food is crap.

The food is cold and not the best taste.

I have stayed here many times over the years, however I think I'm finished.  The hotel is decently priced and in good condition, and the casino is good and has a couple nice restaurants.  However the last three times I had stayed there, I have not been able to get a good night sleep for various reasons. Is this the swankiest joint in Las Vegas? No way, but this place does a great job catering to locals, they have great deals, and everyday low prices. The casino is fairly large and doesn't feel cramped. it can get rather smoky at night. But if you are in the neighborhood,  stop in and check it out. What can it hurt? Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

The cocktail waitress for high limits was much less than nice. I'm sure she feels entitled, but was rude and judgmental. She also argued with me about what section I was in . I walked in to a breath of fresh air. This casino smells so much better than it's perfumed/smoke clouded sister casino Sunset Station. There were plenty of cocktail waitresses for refreshments while gambling, and their theater was exceptionally clean. The parking garage was very convenient for movie goers as well.

Again, expectations. If you go to the Fiesta expecting the Winn or Aria you will be disappointed. The Fiesta is an off strip property so if your intention is to party on the strip this will not be a good choice as you will have about a 20 minute commute depending on traffic. I like it for a locals casino. The buffet is decent and value priced. The property is clean and the staff is overall friendly. We have had a lucky streak lately which probably accounts for a star. We avoided the place for a long time but alas couldn't resist the free food, match play and free bingo.

What can I say? I'm cheap!

All at the last minute I decided I wanted to do a Staycation on Memorial Day Weekend in Las Vegas. Good luck finding anything, let alone anything for a decent price the day before the weekend right? In comes... Fiesta Henderson!

With a room, and two movie tickets, and two passes to the buffet for $119.95 my husband and I were off to our cheap-o hotel fun time. 

Sure the casino isn't great. The movie theater is, well, a movie theater, and the buffet, eh, the buffet - eh. 

BUT - you can't beat the price, even if the room was less than spectacular, but at least it was clean!

The pool too, was clean, and quiet, save for a few kids in the pool - and, sigh, no bar. But hey, my husband and I just brought champagne and chilled it in our ice bucket in the room, and a 6-pack of beer! We snuck our drinks into the pool hidden in normal old cups, and guess what? No one noticed. 

Disappointments - the lights in our room were very touchy, and randomly went on and off. And - no room service, so no breakfast in bed! *womp womp*

Pros - Great package deal and great discount for military. 

If you want to do it on the cheap, here's the place to do it!
Buffet is good. Theater has shows all day for $6

Ok so this is a 2 star casino with a lot of 5 star hospitality. 

The good stuff:
It's quiet, clean, and inexpensive. 

The bad stuff:
It's old, plain, and in need of serious upgrades. Our room was decent but the ac unit sounded like a freight train when it popped on.  

The "whatever" stuff:
There's some decent places to eat, a movie theater, and this place can serve as a retirement home. Or maybe it is already a retirement home because there's tons of oldies here.
Went last night to check out the Greg Peterson Band.  After starting 10 minutes late they were asked by Fiesta personnel to take a brake about 9:25.  The finally started up again about 9:45.

People are over here complaining about every little thing like they're rating a 5 star hotel or had to pay 5 star prices for that matter! This place was a definite last minute steal for us! We were originally planning to stay in Vegas on or near the strip that night, but visiting with our cousin&family who stayed in Henderson (down the street) making it very convenient for us to drive up the road and stay here. It was about 30 bucks (including tax) so definitely cheap. We got there a bit late (almost midnight) but it was clean and decent. The showers were nice and we definitely had a good night's rest before making our trip to St. George 2 hrs away the next day. While walking the casino, I saw that they had a few fast food stations, a Starbucks (BIG plus), a movie theater, their buffet/BINGO was located upstairs and I thought that was pretty cool to include all the extras. I loved it! Would def stay here again if visiting. =)

The Fiesta Henderson is not a bad hotel, but its not a great hotel, either. The rooms are reasonably priced, and decently appointed. They are located a little far from the casino itself, however.

Room service was crappy, and it took forever to arrive. The bar downstairs in the casino, however, had $2 Coronas, and that was quite awesome. Also, the little Chinese diner type place next to the bar provided some seriously good grub at a good price.

This is a great casino. The casinos on the strip are pretty, glitzy and what makes it Vegas, but the casinos off the strip are just as great. In terms of payouts, I'd spend my money here on the slots than on a casino on the strip. 

The staff here are nice, and even though I was visiting, I was still able to sign up and obtain a club card to accrue points, and I even got a few bucks for the slots just for signing up.

The slots here range from really new games to some slots that seems to have been out for a while. There was a genie (as in magic carpets, lanterns, etc.) slot that I really enjoyed, and had a lot of free spins/extra games. 

This isn't the Wynn, so don't expect the Wynn. It's a fun, friendly and casual/affordable spot (and yes, there is a Subway and Fatburger in the gaming area)! I don't drink alcohol, and thankfully there was a Starbucks so I could fill up on some iced tea. Relax, and just enjoy your time here!

BINGO BINGO BINGO!!!!! I love this station casino for the buffet and the ALL paper BINGO! I like the fact they have 2 non smoking sessions and there are no bingo machines. I have won bingo more times here than any other place in town. And of course between my bingo sessions I swing by the feast buffet which is directly next to the bingo room for some great food. I usually have the Mongolian grill cook me up something tasty and I always leave them a tip for doing so (please remember to tip the grill and your server. They deserve it).

The worst experience EVER! Mostly the staff at the hotel were really rude - the exceptions were Kathryn at the front desk, Sarah in security and a nice bartender named Kevin. 
Rude bartenders and rude management! Not only that, someone called my room at 7am posing as the general manager of Fiesta asking for my credit card info... Found out later it was a scam and my card had 2 unauthorized charges listed as "inmate payments" of approximately $400 total. I asked him if he could have security send someone to talk with us- he did but reluctantly.

Terrible - I do not recommend this place to anyone!!! There are nicer places that know what true customer service is- go there instead.

Great location
Easy freeway access
Great restaurants - reasonable priced, well prepared, nice selection 
Weekend - live music in lounge
Why only 4 of 5 stars?  It is a bit dated and the mattresses need to be replaced they are quite worn. And the rooms are not really sound proof, you can hear converstions from the hallway as well as the TV and conversations from the room next door. Usually that isn't a big deal, but when the TV goes on at 2:30 am and stays on until 5:30 am and the people are talking over the sound of the TV then it's a big deal. So if your plan is to stay out all night you shouldn't have any problems at all.

Stayed here for my cousins wedding since it was 5 mins away from the chruch.  Overall the casion is huge, the overall place doesnt smell of smoke too much which is nice.  The staff is nice and answered every question I had.  I personally didnt have too much luck with the slots, however my family did pretty good espeically with the video poker.  One thing I really liked about this hotel was the food selection, they had soo much plus they had a movie theater inside which was pretty cool as well.  The one thing that really turned me off is when I was in my hotel room I saw a bug, and it wasnt just a spider it was huge, although I was super scared I think I killed it.  Throughout the night I couldnt sleep that well cause I kept thinking about the bug.  Anywho overall stay was good besides the bug problem I would say if you want a cheap hotel, away from the busy strip I would stay here! Oh another plus they have $1 margertias everday!!!

I have stayed here a few times, the most recent being in May of this year. 

The Fiesta is a very nice, large hotel. They have a TON of slots and tables, a good assortment of restaurants, as well as tons of shops. 

We checked into the hotel early afternoon, then hit one of the restaurants. We had an event to go to in the early evening, so we had some spare time to play a few slots. Upon our return to the hotel, we ate at the burger place, which was pretty delicious. Then we continued our gambling, into the early morning. Before we knew it, it was almost 3 am, which is when we decided to hit the hay. 

We ended up not loosing too much, but still had a ton of fun. 

The beds were very comfy, and the room was clean. I would defiantly stay here again.

Surprised to such a low rating. We've been here at least 30 times. Not once had we had a bad experience. Last visit we a couple employees go out if there way for us so we decided to post a good review. Food, stay and gaming had always been good. Our service was exceptional yesterday. Thank you

We checked in and then promptly checked back out. Our room was booked on the 10th floor. When walking down the hall to our room I noted that the carpets were dirty and there were groups of rowdy people even though it was 11:30 pm. However, the deal breaker was when I pulled back the blankets and there was blood and an old urine stain on the mattress pad. Nasty.

Ok, so do not eat the buffet here.  Yes it is cheap and somewhat nice, but your stomach will hurt for the rest of the evening.  I came here just for a cheap buffet, so it is my mistake.  i should know better.  This is like most of the other casino/hotels off of the strip.  Lots of smoke, lots of locals, lots of old people (no offense).  The best part about going here was it was the first time I played bingo in a casino.  It was $6 for 6 sheets, and the prizes were between  $50-$150 a game.  Not bad.  It was my fianc√©'s first time playing Bingo ever, which shocked me.  I had fun, but did not win a thing.  Lots of smokers here too, be aware.

This place is horrible.  I will never ever ever come back.  Room is like a motel 6: cramp crowded and no AC.  No hot water.  Staff is unhelpful.  The only manager available is a gaming table manager.  Also the room is so smokey it was like smoking a pack a night. Our eyes were burning.

If your a local, this may be a okay place to chill. If your in town on business and just need a clean cheap place to crash, this is great. If you are in town on holiday or anything of the likes, do NOT stay here. Its just not a vegas experience at all. 

I come into town every week on business, I just get here at night, sleep and get up the next morning and head out for work again. Works great for that.

The parking, customer service on checkin, and room were excellent for the price. There's nothing fancy, but for $19.99, it's a steal. Everything is clean, in decent repair, and recently remodeled. The pool was OK, but was a bit dirty, and there didn't seem to be any staff on hand to maintain or clean it. 

The big problem here is the food. The buffet is AWFUL. Even my 3 year old thought so - she normally devours everything we put in front of her, but touched nothing here except her apple (the one item on the buffet not prepared by Fiesta Henderson staff). My wife liked the Macaroni and Cheese, but changed her mind after they replaced the batch and it started to taste like soap. We watched another patron politely inform a member of the staff that they had mislabeled an item with shrimp as being pork, and listened to the chief get extremely defensive and literally start yelling at the customer. There is "full service"; our "service" consisted of a very angry man who seemed quite upset when we asked for chocolate milk for our daughter; "No, we have REGULAR milk!". He then got our drinks, and never stopped at the table or refilled anything after. My daughter was thirsty; it was odd telling her she had to wait until we got back to the hotel room for a drink of water. Meanwhile, I was scratching my head, trying to figure out why the "international" section of the buffet consisted of crawfish, chili mac, and cornbread, and yams (and no, they didn't mix it up with the American section). 

I had several concerns about the sanitation and temperature of the food there, too. Several items I tried to sample were so old and dry they were nearly inedible. Many items were never replaced, checked, or measured for temperature, as far as I could tell. I have no idea of their standards or the laws here, so I can't accuse them of doing anything illegal, but their negligence ceraintly showed in the abysmal quality of the food. We were there on a slow Monday night, and other reviewers have said the buffet was 'great', so maybe they only bring out their "A" game on certain days.

We did breakfast at the Fiesta Cafe and it was slightly better. To her credit, the waitress even went the 'extra mile' to create a glass of my daughter's chocolate milk (an apparently tall and difficult order at the Fiesta), though we had to tell her the 'recipe'. The rest of breakfast was decent and acceptable for a budget, short order breakfast, slightly redeeming the Fiesta food experience. If you have to eat at the Fiesta, go to the Cafe.

You might think that the "great hotel, horrible food" means you should stay here and just eat elsewhere. The problem is, this hotel is so far (20+ minutes) from the main part of Las Vegas, and going to any of the more well known buffets or food options is impractical. 

Bottom line: spend the $20 more to upgrade to a substantially better experience on the strip, and spend the money on an infinitely better buffet.

so i decided to take a tour of the boulder casinos..this was my first stop...you walk in and its like you were transported to loser island..this place is the bottom of the barrel....cheap tables very few games open. i sat down at a table and wanted to buy in for more then they had in the rack i sat there for 15 minutes waiting for them to bring in a fill..finally i just wasnt feeling it..they were clearly afraid of my action or totally retarded...bad energy....next up..cannery east

I never write reviews but after the experience I had this past weekend thought I should share. The Fiesta used to be nice and we loved the buffet so over the years we have had many get togethers there. The past three times we've been to the buffet we've noticed some of the employees can be quite rude and the food has honestly gotten bad. This last time was the worst most of the food looked old and dried out but we made the best of it and tried picking out food that didn't look as bad. I'm not sure if they got new management or they've just lowered thier standards. Within a short time after leaving the Fiesta we were all sick and it ruined the rest of our weekend!! Blah!!! Needless to say we won't be going back!!!

This is a great locals casino. Staff are polite and friendly. The dealers are entertaining and make the table games even more enjoyable. The table mins are low. The weekend band is excellent and is free to watch. Has a movie theatre that is kept reasonably clean, average theatre quality. Diner and buffet food is acceptable and very inexpensive. Incredible value.

Decor 2/5
Staff 5/5
Value 5/5

I love the buffet here! Much better than sunset station! I live down the rd from sunset but come to fiesta instead. Salad bar is legit! Lots of options, something for everyone. It is not a fancy buffet like on the strip, so don't go into it with those expectations and enjoy it for what it is: a feast of decent food at a reasonable price.  It is similar in quality/environment to a Golden Corral type buffet.

So, this hotel is located in what seems like the edge of nowhere. It is literally where the 215 ends. There is not alot to do near the hotel, unless you are into rock collecting. There is a brand new Target up the street. We wandered out to the Water District area of Henderson which should be renamed the Water Street Ghetto District for the tattooed and toothless. Ghettoriffic!

The hotel was OK. It is very basic and mostly clean. The pool is small and nothing special. They were full for the 4th of July and ran out of bed pillows...long story and I will spare you all the details of my phone conversation with the Hotel manager who eventually, personally, unearthed the last pillow in the hotel for me. 

The buffet was decent, and for the $7.99 ($6.99 if you join the slot club) price quite a good deal. As a hotel guest you get to stand in the VIP line and avoid the wait, which can be pretty long.

Overall, if you must stay in Henderson and don't want to pay the higher rates at the Green Valley or Marriott, I guess the Fiesta will do.

This review is for the casino only. I have never stayed here in the hotel.

Busy locals Hotel/casino on Lake Mead Bl. in Henderson, motorcycle ride close to both the Lake, River and Valley of Fire State Park.  Hotel rooms are a bit worn out and need a redo.  They do have LCD TV's but they are on stands and not comfortable to watch while you're in bed. The accoutrements and bathrooms have the bare basic essentials.  Nothing to write home about.  

Casino is just OK. Good video poker but for craps players, there's only one dice table. This is NOT a destination location for out-of-towners.

This place certainly isn't fancy and I think you'll realize that without reading this review.  But, the people are friendly, and it has a couple of amenities worth mentioning that make it a very solid, and affordable, place to stay in Henderson.  The first is the movie theatre.  It's located near the food court, and away from the majority of the casino.  Additionally, it is close to the entrance near the sportsbook, so you don't have to walk through a ton of smoke to get to the entrance.  I'm not saying you won't experience smoke at all, but it's certainly a much shorter walk from the parking lot to the theatre than you experience at a lot of locals casinos.

The second amenity specifically worth mentioning is Fuego steakhouse.  This place is a FANTASTIC value.  Great old school dining room, excellent service, and the prices are great.  I had a better ribeye here for $34 than I've had at fancy joints on the strip for $20 more.  If you are a beef person and stay at the Fiesta, a dinner at Fuego is a must.  

For a much cheaper price than a lot of its competitors, you can get a clean hotel, near the highway, with a decent sized casino and above average steakhouse.  That's a pretty solid proposition if you ask me.

Stayed here for one nigh when traveling to Northern Cal. The 39 dollar room they advertised turned into a 49 dollar room. They said they were sold out of the $39.00 room so I paid the 49 bucks and went up to my room and logged into their site. 

  There web site said the $39.00 rooms still available. I was just too tired to go down and argue with the clerk.
 So my advice is have your smart phone cued up to there reservation page so when they try and duke you like they did me you will have proof of then miss leading you.

 

  Feasta Henderson you guys duked me and got away with it.

I had a really good time at this casino. I think that it is very very nice. The only negatives that I found with it are number one, they need a much better gift shop, there's really nothing to choose from in the little gift shop. Secondly, they need to remodel the rooms and the hallways. The hallways are very dingy and the doors look like they've been through a war. Thirdly, it would be cool if they have microwaves and refrigerators in the rooms. It would come in very handy, especially when you're staying for 5 days like we did. Lastly, our room was quite noisy. It was surprising because our room was at the very very end of the hall, the very last room. But as it turns out, there is a laundry room right next to our room, and so the maids were going in and out of there all day and all night and it was very very loud and obnoxious.  So I think they should move their laundry rooms to the way other end of the hall, down by the elevators. It's not fair for those of us that have the corner rooms at the very very end of the hall to have to listen to  the laundry carts coming in and out of a room next to us all day and night. Other than that, we really like this place, it was very nice, everything was there that you needed, and they have a very nice theater here too.

I booked here for a quick two night vacation to visit my son in Vegas.  This has been our long time go-to place for the buffet, so I figured what the hell?  I booked Sunday and Monday nights.

Check in was a breeze.  The lady that helped me was very night and checked us right in and sent us on our way.

The room is pretty basic.  Web got a non-smoking two queen bed room.  My husband and I slept in one bed, and my daughter slept in the other bed.  It was cozy.  The room over all was what we needed.  The amenities are very basic in the bathroom, but we always bring out own stuff anyway.  They did have a blow dryer.

We went to the movie theater, which we have been to a couple of times before.  My first question for them was weather we would be able to bring Starbucks in to the movies since they are literally next door.  They said sure!  That was awesome!  I also paid for our movies, and then realized I forgot to show my military ID.  I went back to the counter, and they were more than happy to refund me my discount.  I thought that was very nice of them.

Later that night we sat at the casino bar and played some games.  The two bartenders that served us were both great.  They had awesome senses of humor, and kept the drinks coming.  In several instances, we didn't even have to ask.  I played Caveman Keno, and my husband played Blackjack.  My daughter and I also took a little break and got food from the food court.  She had the pizza place, and I had Fatburger.  Both were awesome!  All in all it was fun!

We didn't end up staying the second night  because something came up, so we checked out and left.  We didn't even make it to the buffet! haha!  I would definitely stay here again.  The rate is very reasonable, as is the resort fee.
Price is great, love the fact kids and dogs are welcomed.  I do not like the buffet serving the same thing daily.  I love the ice cream machine with toppings.  Staff is great, clean, and relaxing.

I've driven past this place many times but finally decided to stop by and see what it was like inside.  Good parking, and (still) free.  Not terribly smoky inside like some other locals' casinos.  Good video poker pay tables and surprisingly good selection of both video poker and slot machines.  The only hangup is that my comp offers come from their chief locals competitor so it is doubtful I'll be spending a lot of time here.  Kind of too bad.

The food and service was great! I'd come back again for the bread rolls and the steak. I was in town for business and I had my mom with me along the trip. The manager Michael was professional and personable and our female server (sorry, I don't remember her name but it was unique and she had been there for more than 10 years) checked on us during each course. Our busser made sure our glasses were not empty and cleared any dishes we were through with. The booth we sat in was comfortable and could easily accommodate even more. Thank you for a great experience.

My friend finally graduated from training at work today, so we wanted to celebrate with a coupld of drinks tonight.  Somewhere REALLY close to our house and somewhere REALLY cheap, so we found ourselves at the Fiesta.  

The special the run on Fridays are as follows: A beer and a shot for $4.00.  A shot alone is $6.00 so you get a lot more for less. Our bartender's name was Craig. For the price we paid, it was well worth it.  I got drunk and didn't have to worry about breaking the bank.  It's one of the best in old Henderson. Smells like smoke, but with those prices, it's ok.  

CLEARLY, I have nothing else to say about that.  We got drunk.  We had a good time and we will be back.

BED BUGS!!!!! STAY CLEAR OF THIS PLACE!!
The customer service is terrible! Yelp should have a negitive review option because this place would win a solid -5 stars for their management alone. 
We were out for a family member who was passing. While we were dealing with that my son called me and says he saw a bug on the bed. I told him to send me a picture and it's a BED BUG! (Pictures attached) 
I immediately called the hotel staff and they sent security and housekeeping who took pictures of now a second bug and confirmed that they were BED BUGS. They transfered us to another room, which mind you was a down grade with the smell of cigarette smoke from the bathrooms and all. 
I asked if there was BED BUGS wouldn't we just be transferring the bugs to the new room? The Hotel Manager, Patrick did not seem to care and said it's never happened before. They further stated that they are going to have a company come and check "free of charge" as if it was my responsibility to cover the cost of THEIR problem. 
I asked if the new room was checked and he couldn't give a straight answer. I later found out that it was not as housekeeping came up to the room 4 hours later.
Housekeeping told me at that time the "professional company" would not even come to check the room or my belongings until the next day at around 4pm....CHECK OUT IS 12??? Now thats convenient....
We had to leave so when we checked out I asked to speak to someone regarding the horrific event and was told the Hotel manager Patrick would be in by 1pm and the Director of Hotel Operations, Kristin, did not work weekends. I left messages for both everyday and did not get a call back for 2 days. (By the way I still was REQUIRED to pay full price for these rooms)
When Patrick finally called he told me that he had good news and there are no bed bugs.....WHAT??? I have pictures AND your security has pictures with a report.....you moved  our rooms because it was CONFIRMED??!!!??He further told me AGAIN that this was free of charge as if that was our compensation for dealing with this...
WHAT A JOKE!!!
SO, if you are looking for a hotel that doesn't care about your well being and you could bring home BED BUGS by all means come stay here at the Fiesta in Henderson.
Just as a side note do your research on how NOT to take these bugs home with you..I had to through away my luggage just to be sure because the hotel obviously didn't care.

Wow 3 times my iron didn't work found hair on my bed and the room was outdated it needs remodeling and also when I took a shower in the morning the water wasn't hot and barley was warm wow no hot water are you serious?,
Your a hotel all guest should have access to hot water this is unfair fix your plumbing problems and make it fair for us to enjoy our stay so we can return each time but by not taken care of us and not making us happy. won't make us return, we spend thousands and get nothing in return please remodel all your rooms and fix your hot water issues and please put new beds and matresses, thank you hope this review gets to the owner.

I stayed here based on the positive reviews and wasn't disappointed. It is a good place to stay overall. The food at the amigos cafe was excellent. The buffet was... A buffet. Lots of food for cheap. The rooms are adequate, but cause I didn't book far enough in advance, I feel like this trip I overpaid for the room. 

I'm not a big fan of casinos, and this one, like many others I have visited, took my money happily while giving minor amounts of satisfaction.
Tried several times to call and make a reservation without any luck. I was put on hold several times and hung up on. They will not learn my business. No wonder they have a two and a half star

If I could do negative stars I would. This hotel is disgusting. If you start by saying a hotel is clean, let that be a warning. Aren't they supposed to be? The rooms smell like smoke. Even the non smoking rooms. The wallpaper is peeling off the walls. The room stinks of the deodorizer they use to attempt to cover up the smoke. The TV isn't connected and doesn't work. The previous guest apparently was generous enough to leave their food behind. I can't believe that this hotel was this bad. I arrived at 2:00 in the morning and was forced to stay the night. At least they had A/C in the room. Too bad it sounds like a train! I found another hotel and left ASAP to check in a few miles away. Run, don't walk away from this hotel. It's cheap for a reason!!!
The guy who checked me in seemed like he wasn't too happy to be there, not friendly at all. The room itself was ok. Clean for the most part and the bed was comfortable.

Hahahaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa This hotel was like a bad Seinfeld episode. 

Mind you I am a the stereotypical New York type Jew, therefore, walking into a hotel/casino that seemed to house the American Hick convention, i already felt really out of place. Toothless wonders zombie-ishly playing slot machines for all eternity, the buffet lines of the same people who kept getting bigger as hours passed..

I had to stay here because I was going to see Vegoose (music festival) and I chose this place due to convenience and location. It is by NO means a nice hotel, though this wasn't what I was expecting. 

There is a pretty large casino though, randomly with a fast food court and movie theatre. It is 20 mins from the strip in a car though, and walking around the hotel at night gave me the heeby geebies. I would never stay here again. oh HELL no.
Had fun here! Sports bar is amazing if Rob is there!!!! Comfy rooms and great drinks!

We stayed here last week because they are a pet friendly hotel. Honestly I should have looked elsewhere. The rooms were dirty, as the maids couldn't be bothered to lift the bed skirts to vacuum underneath the bed. We found a huge earring, dust galore, and what looked to be 5 month old cheetos. We have 2 cats and a small child, the room's uncleanliness was unacceptable. The A/C units were extremely loud and not running as they should, because the room never got that cool.They did not have comment cards in the comment card envelopes so we could not leave a review.

The buffet was lackluster at best. While it was cheap, the quality of food reflected it. I wasn't really satisfied with anything I ate that night, and could definitely tell that most of the food was pre-processed food that I could buy myself at the store.

I give this place 2 stars and not one because the staff was very very friendly. Also, The cafe was great for breakfast in the morning. My veggie omelet was great.
Went to the Regal theater and it was very nice. I like they had new chairs. They were comfortable.  Easy to get around.

I stopped by here on my way out to go ATVing in the desert because I knew casino's usually keep their bathrooms nice and clean.  I also stopped here because we had some time to kill so I sat at their $3 BJ table and played for a good half hour and I even won $55 bucks!  This was a good "pit stop" for me!

Won't go back to stay at this one. Asked for non-smoking room and immediately smelled the smoke in the room upon opening the door. Checked out and went to another hotel. Rooms need an update too.

If going to enjoy the amenities offered within the hotel well worth it but highly discourage staying at the hotel.

I have been going to fiesta to cash my check for 6 years now.. I went on 12-05-15 to the cage to cash my check.  I was called up by Bob. I said hello for him to just look at me... Don't know what is wrong with him but, working in customer service aren't you supposed to be friendly?? Maybe, Bob needs to go behind in the back where he doesn't have to deal with customers..  I worked on the strip for 7 years and, never did I lose my customer service skills!! Bob your attitude sucks!! Horrible and rude!!

The room I got was comfortable enough and had the basic amenities that one might look for in a decent hotel. My only complaints were:

1. The carpeting of the room wasn't the cleanest. After walking around barefoot for a short while, the soles of my feet were rather dirty.

2. Entrace to the guest rooms requires a bit of a trek to the back of the casino, and it took me a few trips in and out to not get lost.

Otherwise, I had a nice 2-night stay. There was a lot of construction in the parking lot, but it looks they are expanding. There's easy access to  Lake Mead Parkway, there are plenty of stores and restaurants not too far away. There's also complimentary coffee in the room, which actually wasn't as bad as I expected.

We booked our stay online for King bedrooms when we got there they had given them to someone else the lady at the front desk was very rude we then went down the next morning and fixed it later the next evening my husband went to gamble and was yelled at by an employee the only good thing I would say about the hotel is the late night cafe is very cheap for ok food bad service and we ate at the stake house it was outstanding all the way around the pillows and shower heads where terrible in the rooms

The restaurants have horrible service and sometimes the food isn't much better. It's funny. I win at other Station Casinos. And this one I don't. Seriously. Seems just a little strange. Plus, the drinks are half size compared to Sunset. And apparently you have to ask for a wine glass when you order wine. That's just tacky. Management needs to review all departments.
Ehh. the staff in the bingo room ALWAYS card my cousin Marissa and I... and we go ALL THE TIME! its so annoying. The Old people in the bingo room are RUDE! just becareful when you go there.

I only play pai gow and I didn't like the options for the bonuses. They don't have progressive bonus like all other station casinos and the regular fortune bonuses pay out less and the envy bonus is less also which didn't make sense I guess because you have a betting spot that you'll get pai gow and if you do it pays out x amount based on the type of pai gow you get. I really don't like betting that I'm gonna goer pai gow. It's a pretty big casino it's seems like Texas station which is a dive and palace station are the smallest casinos that station owns. 

Parking was easy and the ceilings are high so it's not too smokey. I think palace station is one of the worst for smoke.

I love the fiesta its my favorite place to play. I'm a local. I had a huge problem last night. While I was playing at a table my phone fell out of my pocket. I was devastated that I couldn't find it. No one had turned it in and when I tried calling... someone had shut it off. I spoke with security and they acted quickly. They recovered my phone from whoever had taken it. All the memories stored on my phone... all the information we keep on our phones... it could have been so much worse. But thanks to the fast acting security staff I am giving this review on my cell phone. I won't be going anywhere else. I am in awe at the quality of staff on fiestas security team! Marvelous job!

Both Fuego steakhouse and amigos cantina give great service and good food.  Trying out all the station casinos accommodations and for 50 bucks a night it wasn't amazing but it wasn't bad either.   The walls are thin so  be careful not to be too nosy but all in all... Great stay!

Really simply, the Fiesta in Henderson is a great hotel. The staff is very friendly, and the floors are clean. 

The Rooms: The rooms are (surprise) basic hotel ammenitiy rooms.
There's a bed, TV, closet, Iron, etc. There's not a lot of fluff, but then for the price, what would you reasonably expect?

The Casino: The casino is clean, and there is (Even at 2am) always at least 1 person walking around and cleaning machines, and picking up after the people who cant be bothered.

The Buffet: (Full Disclosure - My Buffet was comped)
I had low expectations when I saw the buffet. I figured that it would be a basic run-of-the-mill-get-the-gamblers-fed-and-back-to-the-machines type. I walked and checked the buffet. Salad was crisp and clean, the veggies were vibrant and crisp. There are several stations of the buffet, the most popular being the Mongolian BBQ. There was a line 9 people long, just waiting for their food. I tried it, it was well cooked, and not overly sauced. The dessert section had the standard ice cream dispenser, pies, cakes, etc. What I didn't expect to see there was fruit. It was a nice change. Not just Watermelon, cantelope, and mystery melon. There was kiwi and pineapple, and more.

Overall:
If you look at the Fiesta as a 2 star hotel (one step above a Super 8), you will be pleasantly surprised. If you look at it from the standpoint of the MGM or Bellaggio, then I fear you will be severely disappointed. 

The staff is very freindly, and the food worth coming back to, both in quality and price.
The rooms and Casino are clean. What more can you expect?

We got an awesome deal through Hotels.com for a room . The staff is courteous and friendly at every bar, the buffet and the hotel registration desk. The room was clean and stayed comfortable throughout the night! The A/C was not noisy it did have an interesting fan noise every so often but it was not loud. The buffet has many choices and for 9 bucks you cannot get good mongolian grill anywhere else! The 99 cent margaritas were a good after-spicy-dinner drink! Everyone should try this place!! The only bad thing is the smoke however its not as thick as some of the other casinos!
Love coming back to play and eat !! Bingo is our favorite! Good food great movie theater! Cater to Vets and Sr folks!  We enjoy coming every chance we can!

Went to the cafe this morning as i didnt feel like paying starbucks $2.30 for a sml reg coffee to take to my coffeeless room iv'e been staying in for a week, as i was by myself they asked if i wanted to sit at the snack bar, at 9am i didnt feel like sitting in an uncomfortable seat at bar, asked for a booth since i saw at least eight available and was told i would have to wait 10-15  minutes!  ...., old trick to get u to gamble while u wait, i wet and complained to front desk who called mgr eventually se young girl showed up and stated that they had had a large party?  and led me back to restaurant and snack bar after i had already explained situation to her... she went in back with the hostess who i spoke with earlier. Having lost my appetite and now extremely upset having been discriminated against for being a single woman... I left.  Shall no longer stay here or use their restaurant, it wasn't very good anyhow.

This place is THE PITS!  Stayed here on the way back to CA after visiting UT.  Avoid at all costs.  Perfume smell in the hallways, terrible buffet (even at half price), non-smoking room had so much air freshener it almost made my wife sick.  Look around.  Any place would be better.

If he worst hotel I have been in but still left disappointed. The rooms are almost as interesting as watching professional darts. The front desk lady Erin was a rude woman of the dark ages. I was supposed to have a king size bed but they ran out. They claim it is all sold out but the parking lot is empty and so is the casino. It is fucking Wednesday!! I don't believe you that there is Not another room available. If you want shitty service with underwhelming rooms stay at Hooters. If you want something that is worse stay at Fiesta Henderson.

I'll admit that I hadn't been to the buffet here for several months. It has gone down hill so much I doubt that I'll be back again anytime soon. It used to be a really good buffet, but not any more. The new ownership has taken this once good buffet to the outhouse.  I guess that I'll have to find someplace else to eat on Thanksgiving if I am in town.

The food selection has diminished and was mediocre at best. The cutting board was terrible and the sausage was unedible! Someone should tell them that the garlic mashed potatoes are actually supposed to be mashed. I have to say that the brussel sprouts (yes, I love them) were actually cooked just right. 

Once they had what I thought was the best desert island of any locals casino in the area, NOT NOW! The selection is poor and the once to die for sticky buns are GONE! WTF Stations?

The service was good but I hate eating when a lot of the tables around me are still full of dirty dishes !

I have stayed at this hotel several times.  It really needs an update, the carpet is old so it looks dirty even though it may be cleaned.  The decor is out of date and some of their appliance look like they are on their last leg.  This place is really cheap so that is why we stay here but if they would update the look they will probably have more business that come. One thing I do like about staying here is there are side walks so I can go for a run down the long street that parallels the hotel and cross by shops and other businesses.

The Buffet is priced cheap and there is an ok variety of foods, but none of them are edible unless you are going to starve to death before you can get to a McDonalds. Lived in Vegas 20 years, traveled everywhere and like all kinds of food. This was a quick decision to try the buffet before we drove on to Arizona. Bad decision.

This update is long overdue...

This place was not nice to begin with, but has steadily gone further downhill since my last review.

We used to go here for bingo, because it's all paper.  We now choose to play elsewhere.  I can get more packs at another small casino and spend less money.  Not sure how that works.  Also, the staff is pretty rough around the edges and I find a few of them to be quite unprofessional while calling.

Next, I am still angry that they closed their poker room.  It's been replaced by some BS slot tournament area.  It wasn't the busiest poker room I've seen, but there was a steady group of regulars and the tournaments were fun.  Closing this room was pretty much the beginning of the end for me gambling at Fiesta.

Can they figure out the cafe situation? It went from the cafe to Denny's back to the cafe.  None of which are anything worth mentioning.  Fuego is the only place worth eating at, but not worth going out of my way for.

The hotel rooms are absolutely disgusting.  Old, smelly and in need of a major remodel.  I don't care what they charge, they need a major overhaul.

It's sad to see, because it's not far from my house and I would love to spend my hard earned money there.  But that's just not happening.

Really people? 1 or 2. This is the friendliest and most helpful place I've been to in Henderson. It's a local casino and have one of the best buffet around except Green Valley Ranch. I never stayed at the hotel since my parents in law live in Henderson but we have friends that stayed there and they enjoyed it. I can't say anything about the showers and hot water but maybe u were just in bad luck that day. I love the environment plus it's easy to find parking. They got parkings outside the casino and a 3 floor parking house.

We stayed here for one night on our way through Nevada. It was not the cleanest hotel, and the walls are paper thin!!! After checking in and checking out the casino, we drove 20 minutes to the strip- we both agreed we wishes we had stayed right on the strip! Returning back to fiesta was hard, and we realized how smokey and stinky it was.... The buffet was good tho, everything & really cheap $9.72 each for brunch & dinner with players card.

On April 23, 2012 we decided to take my daughter here for her 12th birthday.. Big mistake!!!! I still can't stop thinking about how horrible it was. We got there about 6:30 pm... Getting in was ok but if you have more then two people they put you aside and take care of smaller groups first.. The wait was ok but I heard other parties complaining that night about being set aside.. I do have to say our server was awesome .. Thanks RYAN .. However!!!! , the food was HoRRIBLE.. gross, Yuck .. There was no fish.. Except crawfish which you could tell nobody was touching..  Most of it was cold or like the turkey was dry .. I'm so disappointed.. I usually don't write reviews but I thought what a waist of money on food that was so awful. Won't be back here again!!!

Stayed here on a recent trip to Las Vegas from 11/15/2014 to 11/18/2014. You should be aware that this is a budget casino located in the suburbs and thus both the casino and the hotel won't be anything near what you'll find on the Strip, but I really enjoyed my stay here!

The hotel is located on the upper levels, and downstairs, there's practically everything you could ever need - a pool, a Subway, a Starbucks, even a 12-screen movie theater. The Festival Buffet is average quality, but good for the price. I don't gamble so I can't speak to the quality of the slot machines or games, but there was a large variety of gambling activities available in both smoking and non-smoking sections.

In terms of the actual hotel, overall, it was a great experience. I stayed in a king-sized suite for about $35 a night, and the room was nice and spacious. A few things could be improved, however:

1. The bathroom light seems to have a motion sensor, and thus, the light would go out while I was in the middle of the shower. This would happen about once every 10-15 minutes or so, and I'd literally have to step out of the shower soaking wet to turn the light back on.
2. As this is primarily a casino and secondarily a hotel (and a budget one at that), there were no toiletries available at the front desk as you would normally find in a traditional hotel. I forgot toothpaste at home and had to buy a new tube rather than take a free one from the reception desk as you would ordinarily do in a hotel. Shampoo, soap, and body lotion were provided, however.

Other than that, an excellent stay for the price. The Strip is only about 15-20 minutes away, and Hoover Dam/the Arizona border is about 30 minutes! Overall, excellent and convenient.

P.S. Try the banana nut French toast at the Fiesta Caf√©!

I brought my family to the buffet because I had a large group and wanted them to have a variety to choose from. Stay away from guy at the Mongolian portion of the the buffet the two guys working that portion made all of my family members uncomfortable. When i went to get Mongolian for myself he mistreated me as well. Ignoring me, throwing food, making a joke with another employee that my food was gross and smelled. I asked him to get a supervisor for me and he ignored me again. So i asked another employee. I did speak with the supervisor Dan and he apologized and assured me he would speak with his employee. I will say my server did a great job! Because of him and the attentiveness of management i gave this place 2 stars. As for the food it was ok at best.

I called at 2:30 am to see if this was a pet friendly hotel. I was assured it was. I arrived for check in at 3:30am. I was then told that the only person working (one for the whole hotel) was on lunch break and not back for an hour. After waiting an hour we were told there are no pet rooms available. I then told him that I asked him at 2:30 if there were are any rooms. He then said he was the only person answering phone calls and he would never say  there were rooms when there weren't. He basically called me a liar and cast me away.

I have never stayed here before, but my best friend is a platinum player and got the room comped for me as I was passing through my home town of Henderson, on the way back to Denver and I was on a non existent travel budget. I gotta say, other than the crazy long wait at my midnight check-in, everything else was very pleasant!

The hotel is pet friendly, which I needed as I was traveling with 2 small dogs, they have bell service which was great because I had to unpack my entire car for this stay, the casino is steps away from the elevator, and there is tons of food options, a theater, and a bowling ally. 

Growing up, I had frequented the theater, buffet, and other food places quite often and I am so glad that as a guest I was treated well too!

Thumbs down today,  bad service  and... Need to re look at how you treat customers... We come often and today treated very badly.   Get rid of young lady at bar  outside of fuegos.   She has  horrible customer service skills

I came here from Reno for a competition when I got here I thought the outside looked very nice. When you first walk on it looks okay. But after getting to the elevator and in the room is where it all went down hill. As soon as you open the door you get a smell like a bad apple car air freshener. Which made me instantly feel sick to my stomach. (The smell is lingering too. I've been in here for over two hours and it still smells awful) the room had two queen beds that looked a little bent up. My beds blanket had a nice little white stain on the top so I quickly found a cleaner lady and got a new one. Then after that was done I decided to connect to the wifi that we played $11 per night for and when it asked my to enter my last name and room number it told me that it couldn't be found! So I called the front desk and asked what was happening. They had no idea. So after dealing with that I just decided to go get some food. They have some nice food selections down on the casino floor (like subway, fat burger, Starbucks, ect.) which is nice. But for paying almost $500 for four days in this place it's really not worth it. It would be nicer and cheaper to just stay at a holiday inn.

The Festival Buffet used to be our "go to" buffet. In the past nearly 3 years since we have returned to Henderson, the buffet has gone down hill. 

First, the desert island was banished. A special section for "Chairman" account holders was installed.

On the food: the oriental counter has very little selection, the same can be said for the Italian and Mexican counters. On the Italian section, only the pizza remains a constant.

On the bakery: the best ever sticky rolls are GONE. The rest of the bakery items are good, but just try to find butter. I had to ask to find butter, it is relegated to the 'condiment island' - no cut up sticks (hard frozen and impossible to spread). Where are the individual cups with a selection: whipped, margarine, real butter?

On the Roast Beef: Like many of the advertised Roast Beef on billboards and TV, the puny cuts given are a far cry from those pictured to lure you in...

Based off the reviews, I really thought that I was going to be stepping into a run-down Motel 6 with muddy carpets and broken slot machines. Boy what a pleasant surprise Fiesta turned out to be.

First off, you'll be hard pressed to find a cheaper spot in Henderson.  By now you should already be expecting that dreaded $9.99 resort fee.  On the plus side, for $30 bucks you get wifi that's good enough to stream non-HD videos (~1Mb/sec).  Internet...check.

On the way up, you'll pass by a decent-sized casino area with a movie theater and eateries like Dennys, Fatburger, and Subway.  Being this far from the strip, It's good to know at least I won't starve to death.  Late night grub...check.

I was here on business, however, so I skipped the casino.  I've got a sensitive nose so a non-smoking room was a must.  I am pleased to announce that even with my hound-like schnoz, the hallway passed the sniffer test with flying colors.  Allergies...check.

Step inside the room and you have, well, your basic room, which looked lifted out of the early 2000's.  Your basic amenities: one CRT TV roughly 27", 2-3 lamps that provided ample lighting, closet, and a restroom.  The beds were made, the restroom was nicer than I had pictured and came with a blow dryer and towels, and the shower didn't get clogged.  Above all, the room was clean.  Functionality...check.

My one complaint: the damn climate control.  It took me a minute or two of fiddling with the high tech central a/c remote before I realized that it wasn't hooked up.  In lieu of it, I discovered a retro wall-mount unit that did the job, perhaps a little too well.  I feel really bad for whoever has to sleep directly next to the blower.  A/C...meh.

So at the end of my stay, my overall impression of Fiesta is a positive one.  It provides excellent bang-for-the-buck, not nearly as ghetto as princess-types make it out to be, and seriously, was anybody really expecting the Cosmo?  Hell, you even get this thing called a "news paper" dropped off at your doorstep every morning.  I have yet to figure out what that is, but rumor has it that old timers enjoy doing crossword puzzles on them.

Great value, check.
